tables.name: valsi
tables.schema: ++id, bangu, w, d, n, t, *s, g, *r, *cache

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a mitten/glove [hand and lower arm garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mountain/hill/mound/[rise]/[peak]/[summit]/[highlands] projecting from land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is at/attending/present at $x_{2}$ (event/location).
rows.n: Atemporal; location equivalent of {cabna}.  Refers to a nonce location for an object/activity that is mobile.  (cf. especially {stuzi} for an inherent/inalienable location, {jbini}, {nenri}, se {vasru}, {cpana}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {cabna}, {lamji}, {tcini}, {xabju}, {jmive}, {jundi}, {vitke})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is small in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ sits [assumes sitting position] on surface $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mathematics of type/describing $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (evt./state) interferes with/hinders/disrupts $x_{2}$ (evt./state/process) due to quality $x_{3}$ (ka).
rows.n: Also blocks, obstructs, baffles; not necessarily forcing cessation. See also {fanta}, {dicra}, {fliba}, {fanza}, {raktu}, {klina}, {bandu}, {cfipu}, {ganlo}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is to the left/left-hand side of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$.  See also cmavo list {zu'a}, {pritu}, {mlana}, {crane}, {trixe}, {farna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ feels guilt/remorse about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ is a loop/circuit of $x_{2}$ [material].
rows.n: Also noose (= {skoclupa}, {saljgeclupa}; there is no indication of shape, but merely that the ends join/meet); closed curve defined by set of points (= {cuptai}).  See also {djine}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of maize/corn [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ leaves/goes away/departs/parts/separates from $x_{2}$ via route $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ leaves behind/takes leave of $x_2$.  See also {litru}, {canci}, {vimcu}, {lebna}, {muvdu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is polite/courteous/civil in matter $x_{2}$ according to standard/custom $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is early by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a volitional entity employing means/taking action $x_{2}$ for purpose/goal $x_{3}$/to end $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also acting at, undertaking, doing; agentive cause with volition/purpose; also $x_3$ objective, end.  See also cmavo list {zu'e}, {bapli}, {gunka}, {jalge}, {krinu}, {mukti}, {rinka}, {snuti}, {gasnu}, {fasnu}, {minji}, {prenu}, {ciksi}, {jibri}, {pilno}, {pluta}, {tadji}, {tutci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a moss/lichen of species/strain $x_{2}$ growing on $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is mossy.
$x_{1}$ is without/lacking/free of/lacks $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$-less.
$x_{1}$ is long in dimension/direction $x_{2}$ (default longest dimension) by measurement standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is loud/noisy at observation point $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a conifer/pine/fir of species/strain $x_{2}$ with cones $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is school/institute/academy at $x_{2}$ teaching subject(s) $x_{3}$ to audien./commun. $x_{4}$ operated by $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ is grateful/thankful to/appreciative of $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ (event/property).
$x_{1}$ is a structure word of grammatical class $x_{2}$, with meaning/function $x_{3}$ in usage (language) $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_4$ may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; $x_3$ and $x_4$ may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) {ma'oste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = {ma'orpoi}, {ma'orselcmi}, {ma'orselste}).  See also {gismu}, {lujvo}, {gerna}, {smuni}, {valsi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is related to/associated with/akin to $x_{2}$ by relationship $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (si'o) is a scale of units for measuring/observing/determining $x_{2}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a key fitting/releasing/opening/unlocking lock $x_{2}$, and having relevant properties $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also $x_2$ fastener, mechanism; code key (= {termifckiku}, {kiktermifra}); $x_3$ is dependent on the type of key, but are those form properties of the key that enable it to serve the function of opening the lock - in the case of a metal key to a padlock, for example, this would be the shaft and teeth.  See also {stela}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ feels ashamed/mortified/humiliated under conditions $x_{2}$ before community/audience $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ ridicules/mocks/scoffs at $x_{2}$ about $x_{3}$ (property/event) by doing activity $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ is perilous/dangerous/potentially harmful to $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is a danger/peril to $x_2$.  See also te {bandu}, te {kajde}, te {marbi}, se {snura}, se {xalni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is automatic in function $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ exceeds/is more than $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni) by amount/excess $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also positive (= {nonmau}).  See also cmavo list {mau}, {mleca}, {zenba}, {jmina}, {bancu}, {dukse}, {traji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) invests resources $x_{2}$ in investment $x_{3}$ expecting return/profit $x_{4}$ (object(s)/event).
rows.n: [also ties up/Risks/gambles.  $x_1$ is an investor; $x_2$ are invested assets of $x_1$; bond (= {jertervle})]; See also {prali}, {canja}, {jbera}, {dejni}, {ponse}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is purple/violet [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a bed/pallet of material $x_{2}$ for holding/supporting $x_{3}$ (person/object/event).
$x_{1}$ has/is characterized by property/feature/trait/aspect/dimension $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{2}$ is manifest in $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Manifested/property/quality/trait/feature/aspect (= {selkai}).  See also: cmavo list {kai}, {ka}; {tcaci}, {tcini}. Need not be a defining property (which is what "characterize" means in English).

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of zinc (Zn); [metaphor: hard metal].
$x_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a/the name/title/tag of $x_{2}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $x_{3}$ (person).
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ is called $x_1$ by $x_3$ (= selcme for reordered places).  See also cmavo list {me'e}, {gismu}, {tcita}, {valsi}, {judri}. Historically used to describe words in the Lojban morphological class allocated for use with proper nouns; this sense has been deprecated in favor of {cmevla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is free/at liberty to do/be $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also unrestricted, unfettered, unconstrained; (adjective:) independent; (adverb:) willingly, voluntarily, freely, may, optionally; (potential:) $x_1$ voluntarily does $x_2$.  See also {pinfu}, {rinju}, {bilga}, {curmi}, {kakne}, {frili}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of coffee from source/bean/grain $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Brew based on a seed/bean/grain; e.g. also chicory coffee, decaf, postum. See also {tcati}, brewed from a leaf, {barja}, {cakla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of rubber/latex from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is music performed/produced by $x_{2}$ (event).
rows.n: $x_2$ event may be person playing instrument, singing, musical source operating/vibrating, etc.; instrument (= {zgica'a}); play an instrument (= {zgica'apli}, {zgiterca'a}, {selzgigau}, {selzgizu'e}); song (= {sagzgi}, {selsa'a}); voice, as used musically (= {zgivo'a}); composed music (= {finzgi}).  See also {damri}, {dansu}, {flani}, {janbe}, {jgita}, {pipno}, {rilti}, {tabra}, {tonga}, {xagri}, {siclu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ observes/[notices]/watches/beholds $x_{2}$ using senses/means $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Behold/watch/gaze (= {vi'azga}); guard/watchman/sentinel (= {zgaku'i}, {jdeku'i}).  See also cmavo list {ga'a}, {ganse}, {viska}, {catlu}, {tirna}, {pencu}, {sumne}, {kurji}, {canci}, {catlu}, {jarco}, {lanli}, {pinka}, {simlu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is strange/weird/deviant/bizarre/odd to $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
rows.n: Also alien, mysterious, deviant, queer, unusual, exotic.  See also {ranxi}, {rirci}, {fange}, {banli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a louse/flea [blood-sucking arthropod] of species/breed $x_{2}$, parasitic on $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a season/is seasonal [cyclical interval], defined by interval/property $x_{2}$, of year(s) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also anniversary (= {citsydei}, {na'arcitsydei}), jubilee (= {mumnoncitsi}); the period of time may be short or long as indicated by $x_2$, and may occur every year or every nth year as indicated by $x_3$ (default every year); ($x_2$ and/or $x_3$ may need metaphorical restriction: {djecitsi}, {pavdeicitsi}; also equinox, solstice, time of year.  See also {cedra}, {crisa}, {critu}, {dunra}, {ranji}, {temci}, {vensa}, {jbena}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a history of $x_{2}$ according to $x_{3}$ (person)/from point-of-view $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $10^{21}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is young/youthful [relatively short in elapsed duration] by standard $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also age (= {nilnalci'o}); (adjective:) $x_1$ is junior.  See also {laldo}, {cnino}, {slabu}, {verba}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ eats/ingests/consumes (transitive verb) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $10^{-21}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a system interrelated by structure $x_{2}$ among components $x_{3}$ (set) displaying $x_{4}$ (ka).
rows.n: $x_1$ (or $x_3$) is synergistic in $x_4$; also network; $x_2$ also relations, rules; $x_3$ also elements (set completely specified); $x_4$ systemic functions/properties. See also cmavo list {ci'e}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {stura}, {tadji}, {munje}, {farvi}, {ganzu}, {judri}, {julne}, {klesi}, {morna}, {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (experiencer) increases/is incremented/augmented in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ smiles/grins (facial expression).
$x_{1}$ inscribes/writes $x_{2}$ on display/storage medium $x_{3}$ with writing implement $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is a scribe.
rows.n: Also $x_3$ writing surface.  See also {papri}, {penbi}, {pinsi}, {tcidu}, {xatra}, {pixra}, {prina}, {finti} for 'author' or specific authorial works, {barna}, {pinka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event/state) is a punishable crime/[taboo/sin] to people/culture/judges/jury $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ laughs (emotional expression).
$x_{1}$ is a member/element of set $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ belongs to group $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is amid/among/amongst group $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ may be a complete or incomplete list of members; $x_2$ is normally marked by la'i/le'i/lo'i, defining the set in terms of its common property(ies), though it may be a complete enumeration of the membership.  See also {ciste}, {porsi}, {jbini}, {girzu}, {gunma}, {klesi}, cmavo list {mei}, {kampu}, {lanzu}, {liste}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] $x_{2}$ expressing $x_{3}$ (property).
rows.n: Also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow. See also {krixa}, {bacru}, {cusku}, {cortu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [value] is a norm/average in property/amount $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) among $x_{3}$(s) (set) by standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also mean, normal, usual; ($x_3$ specifies the complete set).  See also {tcaci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tarti}, {rirci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ utters verbally/says/phonates/speaks [vocally makes sound] $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also voices; does not necessarily imply communication or audience; ('says' is usually {cusku}).  See also {krixa}, {cusku}, {casnu}, {tavla}, {voksa}, {pinka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a banana/plantain [fruit/plant] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the neck [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: a relatively narrow point].
$x_{1}$ is sad/depressed/dejected/[unhappy/feels sorrow/grief] about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains cheese/curd from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ loses person/thing $x_{2}$ at/near $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ loses property/feature $x_{2}$ in conditions/situation $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (rare for cirko), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {po'ecri}, {posyselcri} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {facki}, {ralte}, {sisku}, {claxu}, {jinga}, {pleji}, {canja}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {binra}, {mipri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (process/event) is a test for/proof of property/state $x_{2}$ in subject $x_{3}$ (individ./set/mass).
rows.n: Also examination, proxy measure, validation; (a set in $x_3$ must be completely specified).  See also {ciksi}, {troci}, {jarco}, {pajni}, {saske}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) rewards $x_{2}$ [recipient] for atypical $x_{3}$ (event/property) with reward/desserts $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Differs from earned payment because of atypical nature; rewards need not be positive but are in some sense deserved from the point of view of the rewarder: positive reward (= {zanyne'u}), punishment, penalty, demerit (= {malne'u}, {sfane'u}); $x_4$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posne'u}, {posyvelne'u} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {dunda}, {friti}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jivna}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {venfu}, {prali}, {dapma}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is orderly/neat/ordered in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ runs on surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$ with gait $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bundle/package/cluster/clump/pack [shape/form] containing $x_{2}$, held together by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cow/cattle/kine/ox/[bull/steer/calf] [beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of chalk from source $x_{2}$ in form $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bucket/pail/can/deep, solid, wide-topped container of contents $x_{2}$, made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bulb [body-part] of plant/species $x_{2}$; [metaphor: rounded, bulgy].
$x_{1}$ is a balcony/overhang/ledge/shelf of building/structure $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (abstract) is amusing/entertaining to $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$; $x_{3}$ is what amuses $x_{2}$ about $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ occupies $x_2$ pleasantly; $x_1$ is fun for $x_2$; $x_2$ is amused by $x_1$; $x_2$ has fun (at) doing $x_1$; $x_1$ is an amusement/entertainment/game for $x_2$.  See also {cinri}, {panka}, {xajmi} for funny, {kelci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a blade of tool/weapon $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is in the future of/later than/after $x_{2}$ in time sequence; $x_{1}$ is latter; $x_{2}$ is former.
rows.n: Also sequel, succeed, successor, follow, come(s) after; time ordering only (use {lidne} otherwise); aorist in that $x_1$ may overlap in time with $x_2$ as long as it extends afterwards; non-aorist future (= {cfabalvi}); (default $x_2$ is the space time reference, whereupon:) $x_1$ will occur.  See also {lidne}, {cabna}, {purci}, {farna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is new/unfamiliar/novel to observer $x_{2}$ in feature $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is a novelty.
$x_{1}$ is a nest/house/lair/den/[home] of/for $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Home (= {tercnizda}), house (constructed building) (= {zdadi'u}).  See also {dinju}, {ginka}, {kumfa}, se {xabju}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a pedestal/base/stand/pallet supporting $x_{2}$ (object/event), of materials/properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ makes/assembles/builds/manufactures/creates $x_{2}$ out of materials/parts/components $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Should not be used to express causation.  Cf. {cupra}, {larcu}, {rutni}, {finti}, {gundi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a bay in/of coast/shoreline $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of soap from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of lead (Pb); [metaphor: heavy, malleable, soft metal].
$x_{1}$ is a bird/avian/fowl of species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is directly/vertically beneath/below/under/underneath/down from $x_{2}$ in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ exists/is real/actual/reality for $x_{2}$ under metaphysics $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  $x_1$ is physical (one sense).  See also {fatci}, {xanri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is temporary/not permanent/expected to change in property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard/expectant $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the buttock(s)/arse/rear/seat [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: rounded surface, support].
rows.n: Also ass, behind, butt.  See also {ganxo}, {mabla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a market/store/exchange/shop(s) selling/trading (for) $x_{2}$, operated by/with participants $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: mall, marketplace, shopping center, cooperative, bazaar, trading post, mart; the concept is the function of selling/exchanging coupled with a location, and is more oriented to the larger concept of marketplace than the stalls/shops that comprise it, though it does not exclude the latter individual shops (= {zaisle}); $x_3$ may include both owners/proprietors and customers in some markets, but in most contexts refers only to the operators.  See also {vecnu}, {canja}, {dinju}, {banxa}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/are tong(s)/chopsticks/pincers/tweezers/pliers [tool/body-part] for $x_{2}$ to pinch $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [material] is a paint of pigment/active substance $x_{2}$, in a base of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ approves of/gives favor to plan/action $x_{2}$ (object/event).
$x_{1}$ [individual or mass of hard surfaces] grinds/pulverizes/crushes $x_{2}$ into powder $x_{3}$.
rows.n: May need mosra tanru.  See also {daspo}, {purmo}, {marxa}, {pulce}, {canre}, {molki}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a gymnast at/performs gymnastics feat $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ in activity/state $x_{2}$ exhibits sexuality/gender/sexual orientation $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ courts/flirts; $x_3$ could be a ka[gender or role], ka[attraction to a gender], or ka[type of activity], etc.; (adjective:) $x_1$ is sexual/sexy; $x_1$ is flirted with/courted by $x_2$ (= {cinfriti}, {cinjikca}). Cf. {gletu}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (abstraction) interests/is interesting to $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is interested in $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Use $x_1$ tu'a for non-specific interest in an object; interested in (= {selci'i}).  See also {zdile}, {kucli}, {manci}, {kurji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ feels emotion $x_{2}$ (ka) about $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also mood/humor (= {nuncni}).  See also cmavo list {ci'o}, {cumla}, {jilra}, {nelci}, {xendo}, {ckeji}, {cortu}, {jgira}, {kecti}, {kufra}, {manci}, {prami}, {steba}, {zungi}, {badri}, {burna}, {gleki}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is favorable/great/superb/fabulous/dandy/outstanding/swell/admirable/nice/commendable/delightful/desirable/enjoyable/laudable/likable/lovable/wonderful/praiseworthy/high-quality/cool in property $x_2$ by standard $x_3$; $x_1$ rocks in aspect $x_2$ according to $x_3$
$x_{1}$ is thin in direction/dimension $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; [relatively short in smallest dimension].
$x_{1}$ is an insect/arthropod of species $x_{2}$; [bug/beetle].
$x_{1}$ is a wrinkle/crease/fold [shape/form] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lion/[lioness] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an oak, a type of tree of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is smooth/even/[soft/silky] in texture/regularity.
$x_{1}$ (agent) asserts/claims/declares $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true [can be used for epistemology of authority].
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ states/says that/affirms/purports to know that $x_2$.  (cf. {natfe} which is propositional and non-agentive, {nupre})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Urdu language/culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is red/crimson/ruddy [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ (agent) kisses/busses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is infinite/unending/eternal in property/dimension $x_{2}$, to degree $x_{3}$ (quantity)/of type $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also everlasting, eternity, (= {cimnytei}), eternal (= {cimnyteikai} or {temcimni}). See also {vitno}, {renvi}, {munje}, {fanmo}, {sisti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an instance of substance/chemical/drug $x_{2}$ (individual or mass) with purity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is a dimension of space/object $x_{2}$ according to rules/model $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) returns $x_{2}$ to origin/earlier state $x_{3}$ from $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ moves/gives $x_{2}$ back to $x_{3}$ from $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ goes back/reverts/Retreats. to $x_3$ (= {se'ixru} for agent self-returning to a previous location/situation: renumber places in the lujvo); ($x_3$ may be a location or a person or an event/situation; the latter may also be expressed with {krefu} or {rapli} and a causative like {rinka}/{rikygau}).  See also {benji}, {krefu}, {rapli}, {rinka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the flower/blossom/bloom [body-part] of plant/species $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is floral.
$x_{1}$ is a turkey [food/bird] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of buckwheat/rhubarb/sorrel grass of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a thread/filament/wire [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Christian religion/culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) injures/harms/damages victim $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka) resulting in injury $x_{4}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ reflects Arabic-speaking culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a hotel/inn/hostel at location $x_{2}$ operated by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ learns $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$ from source $x_{4}$ (obj./event) by method $x_{5}$ (event/process).
$x_{1}$ is moist/wet/damp with liquid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) influences/lures/tempts $x_{2}$ into action/state $x_{3}$ by influence/threat/lure $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also impresses; $x_4$ is alluring (= {trivelxlu} for place reordering); $x_3$ may be an achieved action/state, or an attempt to perform an action/enter a state).  ($x_3$ and $x_4$ are normally events or states); See also {djica}, {mukti}, {trina}, {jitro}, {sazri}, {tcica}, {xance}, {stidi}, {kajde}, {maksi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ soaks up/absorbs/sucks up $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ into $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is an absorbant.
$x_{1}$ is bad for $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is poor/unacceptable to $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Be careful to distinguish between a bad/unacceptable event, and a bad/unacceptable agent: $x_1$ does poorly (= lenu ko'a gasnu cu xlali and not normally ko'a {xlali}).  See also {palci}, {mabla}, {xamgu}, {betri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Hispano-American culture/nationalities in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Refers to Spanish-speaking Latin-American countries, not Brazil/Guyana.  See also {merko}, {mexno}, {spano}, {ketco}, {bemro}, {gento}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a wheel [tool] of device/vehicle $x_{2}$, made of materials/having properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a horse/equine/[colt/mare/stallion/pony] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is wild/untamed.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of ink of color/pigment $x_{2}$ used by writing device $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Hindi language/culture/religion in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Defaults to not include Urdu; Indian (Bharat) nationality may be implied (when constrained by {xingu'e}).  See also {srito}, {xurdo}, {bengo}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (person) explains $x_{2}$ (event/state/property) to $x_{3}$ with explanation $x_{4}$ (du'u).
rows.n: Explanation $x_4$ is an underlying mechanism/details/purpose/method for $x_2$ (= velcki for reordered places), generally assumed to be non-obvious; metaphorical usage with the various causal relations (i.e. jalge, mukti, krinu, rinka, nibli, zukte) is possible, but the non-obviousness, and the existence of an explainer with a point of view makes this word not a simple expression of cause.  See also {cipra}, {danfu}, {jalge}, {jinvi}, {krinu}, {mukti}, {nabmi}, {preti}, {rinka}, {sidbo}, {zukte}, {tavla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $10^{18}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ repairs/mends/fixes $x_{2}$ for use $x_{3}$.
rows.n: A repair may be incomplete, fixing only one of the possible uses of $x_2$, hence $x_3$.  See also {cfila}, {spofu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ regrets/rues (abstraction) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is regretful/rueful/sorry/[remorseful] about $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ feels remorse about $x_2$ (= {zugyxe'u}).  (cf. cmavo list {u'u}, {zungi})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (person) is kind to $x_{2}$ in actions/behavior $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Greek/Hellenic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is black/extremely dark-colored [color adjective].
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is awake/alert/conscious.
$x_{1}$ is a/the jaw [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a hundred [100; $10^2$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ reflects Hebrew/Jewish/Israeli culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ hates/despises $x_{2}$ (object/abstraction); $x_{1}$ is full of hate for $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is odious to $x_{1}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is hateful (one sense); $x_2$ is hateful (different sense).  See also {djica}, {nitcu}, {rigni}, {prami}, {nelci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is deep in extent in direction/property $x_{2}$ away from reference point $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Asiatic culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ hurts/feels pain/hurt at locus $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the gland [body-part] secreting $x_{2}$, of body $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ is a secretion of $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ is $10^{-18}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a letter/missive/[note] to intended audience $x_{2}$ from author/originator $x_{3}$ with content $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (cf. {notci}, which has places in a different order; the emphasis in xatra is on the communication between author and recipient, and not the content, which in a letter may not easily be categorized to a 'subject'; {ciska}, {mrilu}, {papri})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the sweat/perspiration from body $x_{2}$, excreted by gland(s)/organs $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a donkey/jackass of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is stubborn/willfully opposing/resisting $x_{2}$ about $x_{3}$ (event/state).
rows.n: $x_2$ may be a person, a state or condition, or a force; the essence is willful resistance.  See also {tinsa}, {pante}, {bapli}, {fapro}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a pig/hog/swine/[boar] [pork/ham/bacon-producer] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Sow (= {fetxarju}), boar (= {nakyxarju}), pork (= {xajre'u}), piglet (= {citxarju}).  See also {mabru}, {cange}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a weapon/arms for use against $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an elephant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an infant/baby [helpless through youth/incomplete development] of species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [concept] exists in the imagination of/is imagined by/is imaginary to $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is mental (one sense), $x_1$ is unreal (one sense); in spite of the synonym, note that $x_1$ is imaginary does not imply that it doesn't exist in the real world; the definition is crafted so that one can talk about imaginary things without claiming that they thereby don't exist.  See also {fatci}, {senva}, {sucta}, {zasti}, {cfika}, {dacti}, {menli}, {sidbo}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of hydrogen (H); [metaphor: light, flammable].
$x_{1}$ is nervous/anxious about $x_{2}$ (abstraction) under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the knee/elbow/knuckle [hinged joint, body-part] of limb $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Metaphor: a sharp bend/curve. See also {korcu}, {jarco}, {jganu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the hand [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: manipulating tool, waldo].
$x_{1}$ is a sea/ocean/gulf/[atmosphere] of planet $x_{2}$, of fluid $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is marine.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ ampere(s) [metric unit] in current (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is good/beneficial/nice/[acceptable] for $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is panicked by crisis $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of alcohol of type $x_{2}$ from source/process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ gets/procures/acquires/obtains/accepts $x_{2}$ from source $x_{3}$ [previous possessor not implied].
rows.n: Also fetch; accept a gift (= {seldu'acpa}).  See also {punji}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ uses levity/is non-serious/frivolous about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ is upon/atop/resting on/lying on [the upper surface of] $x_{2}$ in frame of reference/gravity $x_{3}$.
rows.n: ($x_1$ may be object or event); See also se {vasru}, {jbini}, {zvati}, {nenri}, {vreta}, {ckana}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {zutse}, {punji} for lay upon, {sarji}, {zbepi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) uses up/depletes/consumes/[wastes] $x_{2}$ [resource].
$x_{1}$ is funny/comical to $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$ (nu/ka); $x_{3}$ is what is funny about $x_{1}$ to $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a comedian (= {xampre}, {xamseljibri} for a professional comedian).  ($x_1$ can be a person/object or an abstraction; be careful about possible sumti-raising); See also {bebna}, {cisma}, {cmila}, {fenki}, {zdile}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a oboe/clarinet/saxophone [reed musical instrument] with reed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ hungers for $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ needs/wants food/fuel $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the body/corpus/corpse of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is corporal/corporeal.
$x_{1}$ climbs/clambers/creeps/crawls on surface $x_{2}$ in direction $x_{3}$ using $x_{4}$ [limbs/tools].
$x_{1}$ is exactly/approximately half/semi-/demi-/hemi- of $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ dwells/lives/resides/abides at/inhabits/is a resident of location/habitat/nest/home/abode $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ requests/asks/petitions/solicits for $x_{2}$ of/from $x_{3}$ in manner/form $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also demand (= {mi'ecpe}); $x_4$ is a means of expression See also ve {cusku}.: a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor).  (cf. {pikci}, te {preti}, te {frati}, se {spuda}, {danfu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is food/feed/nutriment for $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is edible/gives nutrition to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is cyan/turquoise/greenish-blue [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is pungent/piquant/peppery/spicy/irritating to sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Ukrainian language/culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is blood/vital fluid of organism $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ broadcasts/transmits [using radio waves] $x_{2}$ via station/frequency $x_{3}$ to [radio] receiver $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also $x_1$ is a broadcaster.  See also {tivni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event/state) confuses/baffles $x_{2}$ [observer] due to [confusing] property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is a wedge [shape/form/tool] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is a flaw/fault/defect in $x_{2}$ causing $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a work of fiction about plot/theme/subject $x_{2}$/under convention $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also story, lie, untrue.  See also {cukta}, {lisri}, {prosa}, {fatci}, {jitfa}, {jetnu}, {xanri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [state/event/process] commences/initiates/starts/begins to occur; (intransitive verb).
$x_{1}$ (ka) is a taste/flavor of/emitted by $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ tastes of/like $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ tastes of seasoning $x_1$, $x_1$ is a seasoned flavor of $x_2$ (= {tsapyvu'i}); vrusi may overlap the senses of taste and smell, since the latter is a significant component of taste.  See also {kukte}, {tsapi}, {cpina}, {panci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is virtuous/saintly/[fine/moral/nice/holy/morally good] by standard $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Holy/saintly (= {cesyvu'e}).  Virtue the attribute is "ka vrude".  See also {palci}, {xamgu}, {marde}, {zabna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (set/mass/ind.) is miscellaneous/various/assorted in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ lies/rests/reclines/reposes on $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is reclining/recumbent/lying on $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a record of $x_{2}$ (data/facts/du'u) about $x_{3}$ (object/event) preserved in medium $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lever [tool] [of apparatus] for doing $x_{2}$ [function/action], with fulcrum $x_{3}$ and arm $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the god/deity of people(s)/religion $x_{2}$ with dominion over $x_{3}$ [sphere]; $x_{1}$ is divine.
rows.n: Also divinity; $x_2$ religion refers to the religious community as a mass.  See also {censa}, {krici}, {lijda}, {malsi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a doorway/gateway/access way between $x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$ of structure $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Note: emphasis on route nature; solid door (= {vrogai}/{vrobi'u}/{vrozu'itci}).  See also {canko}, {ganlo}, {kalri}, {murta}, {pagre}, {bitmu}, {kuspe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an expert/pro/has prowess in/is skilled at $x_{2}$ (event/activity) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a morning [dawn until after typical start-of-work for locale] of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
rows.n: This morning (= {cabdeicerni}); tomorrow morning (= {bavlamcerni}); yesterday morning (= {prulamcerni}, {prulamdeicerni}) See also {vanci}, {murse}, {tcika}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a voice/speech sound of individual $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an heir to/is to inherit $x_{2}$ (object/quality) from $x_{3}$ according to rule $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Pedantically, inheriting an object should be a sumti-raising (tu'a if non-abstract in $x_2$) of inheriting loka ponse the object - the ownership of the object (= {posycerda}, {posyselcerda} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {jgina}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a hundredth [1/100; $10^{-2}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ flies [in air/atmosphere] using lifting/propulsion means $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is anterior/ahead/forward/(in/on) the front of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$. See also {sefta}, {flira}, {trixe}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is holy/sacred to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ varies/changes in property/quantity $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) in amount/degree $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Non-resultative, not-necessarily causal change.  (cf. cenba which is non-resultative, galfi which is resultative and causal, stika which is non-resultative and causal; stodi, zasni, binxo)

rows.d: $x_{1}$ has the power to bring about $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is powerful in aspect $x_{2}$ under $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also potent, has control/mastery.  See also {tsali}, {jitro}, {ruble}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a logical alternation/disjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and/or $x_{3}$ (du'u) is/are true.
$x_{1}$ is an event/state/act of violence.
$x_{1}$ is a/the vulva [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shirt/blouse/top [upper-body garment - not necessarily sleeved or buttoned], material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is permanent/lasting/[eternal] in property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$ [time-span/expectant one].
$x_{1}$ is a guest/visitor of $x_{2}$ at place/event $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ visits $x_{2}$/$x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is irregular/occasional/intermittent in property/action/aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ sees/views/perceives visually $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is visual; $x_3$ can include ambient lighting, background, etc. which may affect what is perceived; note that English "see" often means "look" or a more generic "observe", or even "understand, know".  See also {catlu}, {jvinu}, {kanla}, {minra}, {simlu}, {djuno}, {jimpe}, {zgana}, {ganse}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is brave/valiant/courageous in activity $x_{2}$ (event) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a deputy/vice/subordinate in aspect [or organization principle] $x_{2}$ (ka) to principal $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) harvests/reaps/gathers crop/product/objects $x_{2}$ from source/area $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an era/epoch/age characterized by $x_{2}$ (event/property/interval/idea).
rows.n: ($x_2$ interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; $x_2$ may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); See also {ranji}, {temci}, {citsi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a community/colony of organisms $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an airplane/aircraft [flying vehicle] for carrying passengers/cargo $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is poisonous/venomous/toxic/a toxin to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ removes/subtracts/deducts/takes away $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ with/leaving result/remnant/remainder $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also appropriates, confiscates; alienation is inherent.  See also {lebna}, {muvdu}, {cpacu}, {canci}, {cliva}, {jdika}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is thick/viscous under conditions $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [body] excretes waste $x_{2}$ from source $x_{3}$ via means/route $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ launches/fires/shoots projectile/missile $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$ [propellant/propulsion].
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a gun/launcher/cannon; $x_1$ hurls/throws/casts (more general than renro in that propulsion need not be internal to $x_1$).  See also {renro}, {danti}, {jakne}, {jbama}, {spoja}.

rows.d: (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is fresh/unspoiled.
$x_{1}$ is a bear/ursoid of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is shallow in extent in direction/property $x_{2}$ away from reference point $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a virus of species/breed/defining property $x_{2}$ capable of infecting [at] $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ in property/amount $x_{4}$ (ka/ni).
rows.n: On the other side of a bound, but not necessarily directly 'across' nor at the shortest plausible distance (per {ragve}); also not limited to position in space.  See also {dukse}, {ragve}, {zmadu}, {kuspe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a video monitor/CRT/screen [machine] serving function $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the vagina [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fairy/elf/gnome/brownie/pixie/goblin/kobold [mythical humanoid] of mythos/religion $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also orc, giant, demon or devil (when humanoid-form is presumed by the mythos/religion), bugbear, bogeyman.  (cf. {ranmi}, especially for non-humanoid creatures of myth, {lijda})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is green/verdant [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a bridge/span over/across $x_{2}$ between $x_{3}$ and $x_{4}$ [unordered, typically destination first].
$x_{1}$ is a child/kid/juvenile [a young person] of age $x_{2}$, immature by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Not necessarily human.  See also {cifnu}, {makcu}, {citno}, {panzi}, {nanla}, {nixli}, se {rirni}, {bersa}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is summer/summertime [hot season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is autumn/fall [harvest/cooling season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) kills/slaughters/murders $x_{2}$ by action/method $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is spring/springtime [warming season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is vernal.
$x_{1}$ takes revenge on/retaliates against $x_{2}$ (person) for wrong $x_{3}$ (nu) with vengeance $x_{4}$ (nu).
rows.n: Also avenge; (adjective:) $x_1$ is vengeful.  See also {sfasa}, {cnemu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ has authority/is an official in/on/over matter/sphere/persons $x_{2}$ derived on basis $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ looks at/examines/views/inspects/regards/watches/gazes at $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also look through (= {grecta}, {ravycta}, {bacycta}); note that English "look" often means a more generic "observe".  See also {jvinu}, {minra}, {simlu}, {viska}, {lanli}, {zgana}, {setca}, {viska}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [agent] shoves/pushes $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Move by pushing/shoving (= {ca'ermuvgau}).  (cf. {danre} for non-agentive force, {lacpu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$(s) (mass normally, but 1 individual/jo'u possible) discuss(es)/talk(s) about topic/subject $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [seller] sells/vends $x_{2}$ [goods/service/commodity] to buyer $x_{3}$ for amount/cost/expense $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is a salesperson/salesman/vendor; $x_3$ buys $x_2$ from $x_1$ (= {terve'u} for reordered terms); $x_4$ is the price of $x_2$ to $x_3$ (= {velve'u} for reordered terms); for sale (= {fitselve'u}, {selvenfriti}); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyve'u}, {posyselve'u} for unambiguous semantics).  (cf. {canja}, {dunda}, {janta}, {pleji}, {jerna}, {kargu}, {prali}, {zarci}, {vamji}, {jdima}; see note at {jdima} on cost/price/value distinction, {fepni}, {friti}, {jerna}, {rupnu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ rains/showers/[precipitates] to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is precipitation [not limited to 'rain'].
$x_{1}$ is a chart/diagram/map of/about $x_{2}$ showing formation/data-points $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ turns about vector $x_2$ towards direction $x_3$, turning angular distance / to face point $x_4$
rows.n: Also revolve (= {jincarna}).  See also {gunro}, {jendu}. New definition of {carna} originally proposed by Robin Lee Powell and backward-compatible with the old one. Official definition: $x_1$ turns/rotates/revolves around axis $x_2$ in direction $x_3$.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is intense/bright/saturated/brilliant in property (ka) $x_{2}$ as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also lustrous, gleaming, sparkling, shining (all probably better metaphorically combined with gusni: gusycai or camgu'i); in colors, refers principally to increased saturation (with opposite kandi).  See also {denmi}, {gusni}, {kandi}, {ruble}, {skari}, {tilju}, {tsali}, {mutce}, {blabi}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ breathes/respires $x_{2}$ [gas].
rows.n: (though used to make the Lojban word, clue word vascular is erroneous, actually pertaining to the circulatory system that carries the respired oxygen to the tissues); See also {fepri}, {kijno}, {vacri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ contains/holds/encloses/includes contents $x_{2}$ within; $x_{1}$ is a vessel containing $x_{2}$.
rows.n: [also accommodates, container; containment need not be total; $x_2$ is Contained. in $x_1$ (= {selvau} for reordered places)]; See also {bartu}, {jbini}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {botpi}, {lanka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a cart/carriage/wagon [wheeled vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of wine from fruit/grapes $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an evening [from end-of-work until sleep typical for locale] of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
rows.n: This evening (= {cabvanci}); tomorrow evening (= {bavlamvanci}); yesterday evening (= {prulamvanci}).  See also {cerni}, {murse}, {tcika}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (ind./mass) is part of an environment/surroundings/context/ambience of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is ambient.  See also cmavo list {va'o}, {sruri}, {jibni}, {jbini}, {ferti}, {tcini}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ vomits/regurgitates $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ throws $x_{2}$ up; [violent] digestive expulsion.
$x_{1}$ (ni) is the equivalent value/worth of $x_{2}$ [item(s) of value] to $x_{3}$ for use/appreciation $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ is worth $x_1$ to $x_3$; (for $x_2$ person:) $x_2$ merits (one sense), (adjective:) $x_2$ is worthy (= selva'i for reordered places); merit reward (= {nemselva'i}); receive merited reward (= {vamselne'u}); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyva'i}, {posyselva'i} for unambiguous semantics).  (cf. {jdima}, {jerna}, {vecnu}, {dirba}, {janta}, {kargu}, {pleji}; see note at jdima on cost/price/value distinction, {vajni})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tide [cyclical/periodic expansion] in $x_{2}$ caused by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a word meaning/causing $x_{2}$ in language $x_{3}$; (adjective: $x_{1}$ is lexical/verbal).
$x_{1}$ (object/event) is important/significant to $x_{2}$ (person/event) in aspect/for reason $x_{3}$ (nu/ka).
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ matters to $x_2$ in aspect/respect $x_3$.  See also {banli}, {ralju}, {vamji}, {dirba}, {kargu}, {pajni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the lip [body-part]/rim of orifice $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is labial.
$x_{1}$ is a/the gut(s)/entrails/intestines/viscera/innards/digestive system [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sand/grit from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of air/normally-gaseous atmosphere of planet $x_{2}$, of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shovel/spade [bladed digging implement] for digging $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tax/levy/duty on goods/services/event $x_{2}$ levied against $x_{3}$ by authority/collector $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also custom, toll, tariff, tribute. See also {pleji}, {flalu}, {turni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is space/volume/region/room [at-least-3-dimensional area] occupied by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a window/portal/opening [portal] in wall/building/structure $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ exchanges/trades/barters commodity $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$, $x_{4}$ is a trader/merchant/businessman.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_4$ is/are commercial (better expressed as ka canja, {kamcanja}).  $x_2$/$x_3$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (possibly service), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posycanja} for unambiguous semantics); (cf. {dunda}, {friti}, {vecnu}, {zarci}, {jdini}, {pleji}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}; see note at {jdima} on cost/price/value distinction, {banxa}, {cirko}, {dunda}, {janta}, {kargu}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {zivle})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a farm/ranch at $x_{2}$, farmed by $x_{3}$, raising/producing $x_{4}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is agrarian.
rows.n: Also grange; farming is any organized agrarian activity, not limited to plant crops.  See also {purdi}, {nurma}, {ferti}, {foldi}, {xarju}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is idle/at rest/inactive.
rows.n: in motion, not implying a change in location, is negation of this: {narcando}. See also {surla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ vanishes/disappears from location $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ ceases to be observed at $x_{2}$ using senses/sensor $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also leaves, goes away (one sense).  See also {cliva}, {ganse}, {zgana}, {lebna}, {vimcu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a shell/husk [hard, protective covering] around $x_{2}$ composed of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of chocolate/cocoa.
$x_{1}$ (event) often/frequently/commonly/customarily occurs/recurs by standard $x_{2}$.
rows.n: See also {rirci}, {fadni}, {kampu}, {rapli}, {krefu}, {lakne}, cmavo list {piso'iroi} and similar compounds.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ walks/strides/paces on surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of petroleum/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ hours in duration (default is 1 hour) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shadow/the shade of object $x_{2}$, made by light/energy source $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is territory/domain/space of/belonging to/controlled by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is apparatus/mechanism/device/equipment for function $x_{2}$ controlled/[triggered] by $x_{3}$ (agent).
rows.n: Form determined by/from function; does not imply automated/automatic action - requires an external agent/trigger (a minji may be a zmiku cabra if it requires an external agent to trigger or control the functions that it performs automatically).  (cf. {tutci}, {minji}, {finti}; {girzu}, {ganzu} for organizational apparatus, {pilno})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tool/utensil/resource/instrument/implement used for doing $x_{2}$; [form determines function].
rows.n: (cf. {cabra}, {minji}, se {pilno}, {zukte}, {sazri}, basic tool types: {salpo}, {pulni}, {cfine}, {klupe}, {jendu}, {xislu}, {vraga}; utensils: {forca}, {smuci}, {dakfu}; specifics: {balre}, {mruli}, {cinza}, {garna}, {pijne}, {pambe}, {canpa}, {pilno}, {vraga})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ governs/rules/is ruler/governor/sovereign/reigns over people/territory/domain/subjects $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ need not be complete specification of set of governed; reign/rule (= {noltru}); king/queen/sovereign (= {nolraitru}); pure democracy (= {roltrusi'o}), representative democracy (= {rolka'itrusi'o}), viceroy (= {ka'itru}), pure communism (= {kaurpo'esi'o}), board of directors/trustees, steering committee (= {trukamni}); government (= {trugunma}, {trugri} (emphasizing the components), {truci'e} (emphasizing the organization)).  See also {catni}, {minde}, {tutra}, {jecta}, {gugde}, {ponse}, {jitro}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is current at/in the present of/during/concurrent/simultaneous with $x_{2}$ in time.
rows.n: (default $x_2$ is the present resulting in:) $x_1$ is now; time relationship only, 'aorist' claiming simultaneity does not mean one event does not extend into the past or future of the other. See also {zvati}, {balvi}, {purci}, cmavo list {ca}, cmavo list {ca'a}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the leg [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: supporting branch].
$x_{1}$ is embarrassed/disconcerted/flustered/ill-at-ease about/under conditions $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ (object, usually pointed) pokes/jabs/stabs/prods $x_{2}$ (experiencer).
$x_{1}$ gulps/swallows.
rows.n: $x_1$ swallows down food/drink. $x_2$ (= {tulpinxe}, {tulcti}, {ctitu'o} (the latter two are more general - for food or beverage); swallow/engulf (= {galxycti}, {galxynerbi'o}, {galxygre}.  See also {citka}, {pinxe}, {galxe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of copper (Cu); [metaphor: reddish, electrical conductor].
$x_{1}$ is a sibling of $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a parcel/expanse of land at location $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is terrain.
$x_{1}$ is a brush for purpose $x_{2}$ (event) with bristles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tulip (defined by flower shape) of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ teaches audience $x_{2}$ ideas/methods/lore $x_{3}$ (du'u) about subject(s) $x_{4}$ by method $x_{5}$ (event).
rows.n: Also instruct, instructor, educate, educator, teacher, professor, pedagogue; (adjective:) $x_1$/$x_5$ is pedagogical.  See also {ckule}, {cilre}, {tadni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [person] agrees with person(s)/position/side $x_{2}$ that $x_{3}$ (du'u) is true about matter $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is brown/tan [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (def. 1) local weight unit(s) [non-metric], standard $x_{3}$, subunits [e.g. ounces] $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {grake}, {junta}, {tilju}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {kramu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a length of tubing/pipe/hollow cylinder [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, hollow of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also tube, sleeve, leg, hose, (adjective:) tubular.  See also {kevna}, {canlu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is foggy/misty/covered by a fog/mist/vapor of liquid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an amount of cloth/fabric of type/material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Buddhist culture/religion/ethos in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a stage/platform/dais/[scaffold] at/in $x_{2}$ supporting $x_{3}$, made of material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$(s) is/are (a) seed(s)/spore(s) [body-part] of organism $x_{2}$ for producing offspring $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also germ cell; implies actual potential for self-development; seeds generally contain embryo and food, and hence would include a fertilized egg. See also {tarbi}, {dembi}, {grute}, {jbari}, {sombo}, {spati}, {sovda}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is brother of/fraternal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necess. biological].
$x_{1}$ is a seasoning/condiment/spice causing flavor/effect $x_{2}$ (event/property).
$x_{1}$ is an expanse of sky/the heavens at place $x_{2}$; [celestial].
$x_{1}$ is strong/powerful/[tough] in property/quality $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
5th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
$x_{1}$ tries/attempts/makes an effort to do/attain $x_{2}$ (event/state/property) by actions/method $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is posterior/behind/back/in the rear of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$; spine (= {rixybo'u}, {rixybo'ukamju}).  See also {crane}, {rebla}, {mlana}, {pritu}, {zunle}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ attracts/appeals to/lures $x_{2}$ (person/event) with property/quality $x_{3}$ (ka).
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is alluring to $x_2$.  See also {djica}, {nelci}, {rigni}, {xlura}, {maksi}.

rows.d: 4th assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
$x_{1}$ is a tree of species/cultivar $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a train [vehicle] of cars/units $x_{2}$ (mass) for rails/system/railroad $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
rows.n: A railed vehicle or train of vehicles; also subway ({tu'unre'e}), metro, trolley, tramway (= {lajre'e}), roller coaster; monorail (= {dadre'e}); cable car, sky car, ski lift (= {cildadre'e}).  See also {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is taut/tense/strained tight in direction $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of nitrogen/ammonia/nitrates.
$x_{1}$ is superlative in property $x_{2}$ (ka), the $x_{3}$ extreme (ka; default ka zmadu) among set/range $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is $x_3$-est/utmost in $x_2$ among $x_4$; $x_1$ is the $x_3$ end of $x_4$; $x_1$ is extreme; $x_1$ is simply $x_3$.  (cf. cmavo list {rai}, {jimte}, {milxe}, {mutce}, note contrast with milxe and mutce rather than with mleca and zmadu, which are values for $x_3$, {banli}, {curve}, {fanmo}, {krasi}, {manfo}, {prane})

rows.d: 3rd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
2nd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
1st assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure).
$x_{1}$ twists under load/force/torsion $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is short in dimension/direction $x_{2}$ (default longest dimension) by measurement standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects British/United Kingdom culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tone/note of frequency/pitch $x_{2}$ from source $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) defends/protects $x_{2}$ (object/state) from threat/peril/potential $x_{3}$ (event).
rows.n: Also secures (verb); $x_1$ wards/resists $x_3$; protective cover/shield (= {badgai}).  See also {ckape}, {fanta}, {fapro}, {marbi}, {rivbi}, {zunti}, {snura}, {binra}, {lunbe}, {pulji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a butterfly/moth of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an oven [enclosure that heats its contents] for baking/heating/drying $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is round/circular [2-dimensional shape/form]; $x_{1}$ is a disk/circle/ring.
rows.n: Normally used for a filled-in circle/disk, but emphasis on roundness means that the concept may include 'ring'.  See also {djine}, {ranji}, {bolci}, {tarmi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an office/bureau/work-place of worker $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a breeze/wind/gale from direction $x_{2}$ with speed $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ blows from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is a predicate relationship with relation $x_{2}$ among arguments (sequence/set) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_3$ are related by relation $x_2$ (= {terbri} for reordered places).  ($x_3$ is a set completely specified); See also {sumti}, {fancu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is ready/prepared for $x_{2}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ reflects Brazilian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a daughter of mother/father/parents $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ broadcasts/televises programming $x_{2}$ via medium/channel $x_{3}$ to television receiver $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also $x_1$ is a broadcaster; $x_2$ programming (mass), program/show (ind.).  See also {cradi}, {skina}, {vidni}, {benji}, {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a book containing work $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ preserved in medium $x_{5}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is a copy/manifestation/container (a physical object or its analogue) of a literary work [$x_2$], not necessarily using paper (= {selpapri}). See also {cfika}, {prina}, {prosa}, {tcidu}, {papri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is sweet/sugary/saccharine to observer $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object) fills/becomes stuffed [up]/inflates/blows up with material $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ pours into $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Implies some relative degree of fullness will result; agentive filling (= {tisyse'a}, {tisygau}, {tisyzu'e}); inflate/become inflated/blow up (= {gacytisna}, agentive {gacyse'a}); pour into (= {liktisna}, agentive {likse'a}).  See also {culno}, {kunti}, {rinci}, {setca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tiger/leopard/jaguar/[tigress] of species/breed $x_{2}$ with coat markings $x_{3}$.
rows.n: a great cat noted/recognized by its markings, metaphorically: stripes, tiger markings. See also {mlatu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of iron (Fe); [metaphor: strong, durable, tarnishing].
$x_{1}$ hears $x_{2}$ against background/noise $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ is audible; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is aural.
$x_{1}$ is hail/sleet/freezing rain/solid precipitation of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
rows.n: This is the substance, not the act or manner of its falling, which is carvi.  See also {carvi}, {snime}, {bisli}, {tcima}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is stiff/rigid/inflexible/resistant in direction $x_{2}$ against force $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also sometimes: firm, hard;  not limited to physical forces; e.g. mental rigidity.  See also {bapli}, {jdari}, {nandu}, {torni}, {trati}, {xarnu}, {danre}, {stodi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an enemy/opponent/adversary/foe of $x_{2}$ in struggle $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of tin (Sn); [metaphor: cheap or base metal].
$x_{1}$ obeys/follows the command/rule $x_{2}$ made by $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is obedient.
$x_{1}$ is heavy/weighty in mass/weight by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ kicks [hits with $x_{1}$'s foot/feet $x_{4}$] $x_{2}$ in/at locus $x_{3}$, using $x_{1}$'s foot/feet $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wave [periodic pattern] in medium $x_{2}$, wave-form $x_{3}$, wave-length $x_{4}$, frequency $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sheet/foil/blanket [2-dimensional shape/form flexible in 3 dimensions] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ performs $x_{2}$ [performance] for/before audience $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container for $x_{2}$, made of material $x_{3}$ with lid $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is full/completely filled with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is possible under conditions $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ may/might occur; $x_{1}$ is a maybe.
$x_{1}$ is humble/modest about $x_{2}$ (abstraction); $x_{1}$ displays humility about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the bone/ivory [body-part], performing function $x_{2}$ in body of $x_{3}$; [metaphor: calcium].
rows.n: $x_2$ is likely an abstract: may be structure/support for some body part, but others as well such as the eardrum bones; the former can be expressed as (tu'a le <body-part>); cartilage/gristle (= {ranbo'u}), skeleton (= {bogygreku}).  See also {greku}, {denci}, {jirna}, {sarji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a trillion [$10^{12}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is an amphibian of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ fears $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is afraid/scared/frightened by/fearful of $x_{2}$ (event/tu'a object).
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ feels terror about $x_2$; $x_2$ is fearsome/fearful/frightening/scary to $x_1$ (= {selte'a} to reorder places).  See also {snura}, {xalni}, {xanka}, {virnu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the Earth/the home planet of race $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is terrestrial/earthbound.
rows.n: (cf. {lunra}, {plini}, {solri}, {kensa}, {tsani}; {dertu} for ground, dirt, except when used to express physical relative frame of reference E.g. on the ground, the ground beneath us.  {tsani})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of millet [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (property-ka) is a texture of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is the exponential result of base $x_{2}$ to power/exponent $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is random/fortuitous/unpredictable under conditions $x_{2}$, with probability distribution $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also accidental, chancy, by chance, adventitious, arbitrary (also = {cuncu'a}, {cunselcu'a}, {cunjdi}, {cunseljdi}; based on "unpredictable").  See also {cnici}, {lakne}, {funca}, {kalsa}, {snuti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the time-duration/interval/period/[elapsed time] from time/event $x_{2}$ to time/event $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an affair/organized activity involving person(s) $x_{2}$ (ind./mass); $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s business.
rows.n: Also matter, concern; $x_2$ is engaged in $x_1$ (which is usually an abstraction) (= {selcu'u} for reordered places). See also {jikca}, {srana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ produces $x_{2}$ [product] by process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) lets/permits/allows $x_{2}$ (event) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ grants privilege $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Sufficient condition (= {crutcini}), agent that permits a situation (= {tcinycru}).  See also {rinju}, {banzu}, {ralte}, {jimte}, {jaspu}, {zifre}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a worm/invertebrate animal of species/breed $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also mollusk, snail (= {cakcurnu}), shellfish (= {xaskemcakcurnu}, {xaskemcakydja}); the generalization to invertebrate is because many multicellular invertebrates are indeed wormlike.  See also {since}, {silka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a ball/sphere/orb/globe [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a spherical object [made of $x_{2}$].
$x_{1}$ is pure/unadulterated/unmitigated/simple in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is a label/tag of $x_{2}$ showing information $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) expresses/says $x_{2}$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) for audience $x_{3}$ via expressive medium $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also says.  See also {bacru}, {tavla}, {casnu}, {spuda}, cmavo list {cu'u}, {bangu}, {dapma}, {jufra}, {pinka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [state/property] is a situation/condition/state/position/are conditions/circumstances of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Characteristics or environment of an object/event/process stage or state that are typically/potentially only temporary.  See also {stuzi}, {zvati}, {vanbi}, ve {pruce}, {ckaji}, {zasni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is weather at place/region $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is meteorological.
$x_{1}$ is a detail/feature/particular of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [hours, minutes, seconds] is the time/hour of state/event $x_{2}$ on day $x_{3}$ at location $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also o'clock, time-of-day.  (time units in $x_1$ are specified as numbers separated by pi'e or are unit values massified with joi); See also cmavo list {ti'u}, {cacra}, {cerni}, {detri}, {donri}, {djedi}, {junla}, {nicte}, {mentu}, {snidu}, {temci}, {vanci}, {dirba}, {mokca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [agent] reads $x_{2}$ [text] from surface/document/reading material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a reader.
$x_{1}$ (event/experience) misleads/deceives/dupes/fools/cheats/tricks $x_{2}$ into $x_{3}$ (event/state).
rows.n: Agentive deception (= {ticygau}, {ticyzu'e}); $x_3$ could be an action or a belief on the part of $x_2$; harmful intent or result is not implied (= {malticyzu'e} for such harmful intent); self deception (= {sezytcica}); deceive/trick into misguided action (= {ticyxlu}); misguided belief (= {tickri}); fib/lie/tell an untruth/lie/fib (= {ticysku}, {jifsku}), white lie (= {zanticysku}).  See also {stace}, {xlura}, {stidi}, {kajde}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ stretches/extends to range $x_{2}$ [interval/extent] in dimension $x_{3}$ from relaxed range $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shoe/boot/sandal for covering/protecting [feet/hooves] $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of tea brewed from leaves $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a station/node of/in/on transport/communication/distribution system/network $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be represented by massed vehicles of system.  See also {dargu}, {litru}, {pluta}, {trene}, {ciste}, ve {mrilu}, {tivni}, {cradi}, ve {benji}, {fonxa}, {dikca}, {fatri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a town/city of metropolitan area $x_{2}$, in political unit $x_{3}$, serving hinterland/region $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a custom/habit/[ritual/rut] of $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is customary/usual/the practice.  See also {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {jinzi}, {ckaji}, {cnano}, {tarti}, {ritli}, {javni}, {zekri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is dress/a garment/clothing for wearing by $x_{2}$ (gender/species/body part) serving purpose $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ can wear/is wearing $x_1$; refers to something intended for use as a garment, not merely something that happens to be worn at some time (which need not be true for dasni).  See also {creka}, {cutci}, {daski}, {dasni}, {gluta}, {kosta}, {mapku}, {palku}, {pastu}, {skaci}, {smoka}, {lunbe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ talks/speaks to $x_{2}$ about subject $x_{3}$ in language $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Not limited to vocal speech, but this is implied by the $x_4$ without context of some other medium of conversation (use {cusku}, {casnu}, {skicu}, {ciksi} for weaker implication of vocal communication); converse/discuss/chat (= {simta'a}, {simsku}, {vricysimta'a} for a conversation not clearly delimited by subject).  See also {bacru}, {cusku} for actual expression, {casnu}, {darlu}, {skicu}, {ciksi}, {bangu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the chest/thorax/upper trunk/[rib cage/breast] [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a boat/ship/vessel [vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the breast/mammary/teat [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: projection providing liquid].
$x_{1}$ is tired/fatigued by effort/situation $x_{2}$ (event); $x_{1}$ needs/wants rest.
$x_{1}$ chooses/selects $x_{2}$ [choice] from set/sequence of alternatives $x_{3}$ (complete set).
$x_{1}$ is a block [3-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, surfaces/sides $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_3$ sides/surfaces should include number, size, and shape; also polyhedron (= {pitybli} having flat/planar sides/surfaces).  regular polyhedron (= {kubybli}, {blikubli}), brick (= {kitybli}); See also {tapla}, {kubli}, {tanbo}, {canlu}, {kojna}, {sefta}, {bolci}, {kurfa}, {tarmi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ thirsts for $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ needs/wants drink/fluid/lubrication $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ behaves/conducts oneself as/in-manner $x_{2}$ (event/property) under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [ideal] is the conceptual shape/form of object/abstraction/manifestation $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
rows.n: Also pattern; $x_1$ is the mathematical or theoretical ideal form, while $x_2$ is an object/event manifesting that form; e.g. circular/circle-shaped (= {cukseltai}) vs. circle (={cuktai}, while {cukla} alone is ambiguous); model (= {ci'ersaptai}, {saptai}, {ci'ersmitai}, {smitai}).  See alse {nejni}, te {marji} for physical shape, {tapla}, {bliku}, {kubli}, {kurfa}, {cukla}, {mapti}, {morna}, {sarlu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of tar/asphalt from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a star/sun with stellar properties $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an embryo/zygote/fetus/fertilized egg with mother $x_{2}$, and father $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tile/cake [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$, thickness $x_{4}$.
rows.n: A tile is a 3-dimensional object, relatively uniform and significant in the 3rd dimension, but thin enough that its shape in the the other two dimensions is a significant feature; 'city block' is conceptually a tile; polygon (= {taplytai} or {kardytai} - shaped like an approximately-2-dimensional block, {lijyclupa} - a loop composed of lines).  (cf. {bliku}, {kubli}, {matci}; {karda}, for which the 3rd dimension is insignificant, {bliku}, {kurfa}, {matci}, {plita}, {tarmi})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is blue [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a box/carton/trunk/crate for contents $x_{2}$, and made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a pan/basin/tub/sink, a shallow container for contents $x_{2}$, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also bowl.  See also {baktu}, {palne}, {palta}, {patxu}, {kabri} for a bowl that is normally lifted for use, {botpi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a binary metaphor formed with $x_{2}$ modifying $x_{3}$, giving meaning $x_{4}$ in usage/instance $x_{5}$.
rows.n: ($x_2$ and $x_3$ are both text or both si'o concept) See also {gismu}, {smuni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of tobacco [leaf] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is the trigonometric tangent of angle/arctangent $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the tongue [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (metaphor: similar to nazbi, tamji, degji).
$x_{1}$ is a board/plank [3-dimensional long flat rectangle] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is cousin to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie $x_{3}$; [non-immediate family member, default same generation].
rows.n: Probably preferred for metaphorical siblings (over bruna). See also {dzena}, {famti}, {mensi}, {bruna}, {tunba}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the thumb/big toe [body-part] on limb $x_{2}$ of $x_{3}$; [metaphor based on relative shape].
rows.n: Thumb (specifically the hand = {xantamji}), big toe (= {jmatamji}).  See also {degji}, {tance}, {xance}, {jamfu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tomato [fruit/vegetable/plant] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) challenges $x_{2}$ at/in property $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains glass of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is white/very-light colored [color adjective].
rows.n: Pale forms of other colors are a compound of white; e.g. pink (= {labyxu'e}, {xunblabi}) (whereas kandi is used for pale = dimness, lack of intensity).  See also {skari}, {xekri}, {grusi}, {kandi}, {manku}, {carmi}, {bakri}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a drawer/file in structure $x_{2}$, a [sliding compartment] container for contents $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wall/fence separating $x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$ (unordered) of/in structure $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a material object enduring in space-time; $x_{1}$ is a thing.
$x_{1}$ is snug/tight on $x_{2}$ in dimension/direction $x_{3}$ at locus $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains ice [frozen crystal] of composition/material $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Composition including $x_2$, which need not be a complete composition.  See also {kunra}, {runme}, {lenku}, {krili}, {bratu}, {snime}, {carvi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ studies/is a student of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a scholar; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is scholarly.
$x_{1}$ [process] is a method/technique/approach/means for doing $x_{2}$ (event) under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also practice/way/mode; style/manner/conduct (= {tratadji}); pattern (= {montadji}, {tadjymo'a}, or {platadji}, {tadjypla}).  See also {ciste}, {pruce}, {zukte}, {pluta}, cmavo list {ta'i}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a horn/trumpet/trombone/bugle [brass-wind/lip-reed musical instrument].
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of carbon/graphite/[diamond]/charcoal; $x_{1}$ is organic.
$x_{1}$ is certain/sure/positive/convinced that $x_{2}$ is true.
$x_{1}$ is a/the arm [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: branch with strength].
rows.n: Also elbow (= {bircidni}), wrist (= {xanterjo'e}), appendage (but jimca, rebla preferred).  See also {jimca}, {janco}, {xance}, {rebla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is an amount of beer/ale/brew brewed from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the Taoist culture/ethos/religion in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is fast/swift/quick/hastes/rapid at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ relaxes/rests/is at ease in/by doing/being $x_{2}$ (activity).
$x_{1}$ becomes/changes/converts/transforms into $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Resultative, not-necessarily causal, change.  (cf. {cenba} for non-resultative, {galfi} for causal, {stika} for non-resultative, non-causal change; {zasni})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ insures/indemnifies $x_{2}$ (person) against peril $x_{3}$ (event) providing benefit(s) $x_{4}$ (event).
rows.n: Also $x_3$ loss; sell/purchase insurance (= {binryve'u}), premium (= {binrydi'a}, or {binryvelve'u}).  See also {bandu}, {cirko}, {betri}, {basti}, {bilma}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/made from/consists of wool [tight curly hair] from animal/species/source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of garlic [bulb] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the argument of predicate/function $x_{2}$ filling place $x_{3}$ (kind/number).
$x_{1}$ reflects Indonesian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) smells/scents (transitive verb) $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ smells/has odor/scent to observer $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mathematical sum/result/total of $x_{2}$ plus/increased by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) is sudden/sharply changes at stage/point $x_{2}$ in process/property/function $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is military/regimented/is strongly organized/prepared by system $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also paramilitary; soldier in its broadest sense - not limited to those trained/organized as part of an army to defend a state (= {bilpre}).  See also {jenmi} for a military force, {sonci}, {ganzu}, {pulji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the hoof [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is ill/sick/diseased with symptoms $x_{2}$ from disease $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is dry of liquid $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is arid.
$x_{1}$ (si'o) is abstracted/generalized/idealized from $x_{2}$ [something concrete] by rules $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is bound/obliged to/has the duty to do/be $x_{2}$ in/by standard/agreement $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ must do $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also $x_3$ frame of reference.  See also {zifre}, {fuzme}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ whips/lashes/snaps [a sudden violent motion].
$x_{1}$ is an inherent/inalienable site/place/position/situation/spot/location of $x_{2}$ (object/event).
rows.n: Generally used for normally stationary objects/events, to give their 'permanent' location.  See also cmavo list {tu'i}, {jmive}, {diklo}, {zvati}, {tcini}, {xabju}, {jibni}, {judri}, {lamji}, {mokca}, {stali}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a structure/arrangement/organization of $x_{2}$ [set/system/complexity].
rows.n: ($x_2$, if a set, is completely specified); See also {ganzu}, {morna}, {ciste}, {lujvo}, {greku}, {gerna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is to the east/eastern side of $x_{2}$ according to frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bee/wasp/hornet of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is constant/invariant/unchanging in property $x_{2}$ (ka) in response to stimulus/conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a chair/stool/seat/bench, a piece or portion of a piece of furniture intended for sitting.
$x_{1}$ is a bead/pebble [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) adjusts/regulates/changes $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) in amount/degree $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Non-resultative, causal change; agentive adjust (= {cnegau}, {tikygau}, {tikyzu'e}).  See also {cenba} which need not be causal, {galfi} which is causal and resultative, {binxo} which need not be causal but is resultative, {zasni}, {stodi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) suggests/proposes idea/action $x_{2}$ to audience $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ (event) inspires $x_{2}$ in/among $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Event which inspires/suggests/is suggestive (= {faurti'i}, {sidyfau}).  See also cmavo list {ti'i}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is to the west/western side of $x_{2}$ according to frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ steradian(s) [metric unit] in solid angle (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lock/seal of/on/for sealing $x_{2}$ with/by locking mechanism $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the head [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: uppermost portion].
$x_{1}$ (ka) is specific/particular/specialized/[special]/a defining property of $x_{2}$ among $x_{3}$ (set).
rows.n: [$x_2$ are members/individuals of a subset of $x_3$; object whose association is specific/defining of a subset or individuals (= {tecra'a}, also cf. cmavo list {po'e}, [$x_2$ is also special to $x_1$]); also: especially/strongly/specifically associated]; ($x_3$ is completely specified set)]; See also {srana}, se {ponse}, {ckini}, {tcila}, {tutra}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ feels frustration about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ has a talent/aptitude/innate skill for doing/being $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of soup/stew/olla/olio [food] of ingredients including $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component of $x_1$.  See also {sanmi}, {mixre}, {salta}, {sanso}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ steps/treads on/in surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the stalk/stem/trunk [body-part] of plant/species $x_{2}$; [metaphor: main support].
$x_{1}$ remains/stays at/abides/lasts with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of ceramic made by $x_{2}$, of composition $x_{3}$, in form/shape $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Made of baked clay or other non-metallic solid; $x_3$: composition including $x_3$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {kliti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the edible $x_{2}$ portion of plant $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a vegetable.
rows.n: Note that fruits and nuts are also vegetables; generally this word will be used for either the general category of edible plants, or for non-fruit vegetables (= {nalrutstagi}).  See also {grute}, {kobli}, {narge}, {sluni}, {spati}, {sunga}, {tamca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is honest/open/truthfully revealing to/candid/frank with $x_{2}$ about matter/fact $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ encircles/encloses/is surrounding $x_{2}$ in direction(s)/dimension(s)/plane $x_{3}$.
rows.n: ({jinsru} =) $x_1$ is a ring/belt/band/girdle around/circling/ringing $x_2$ near total containment in some dimension(s).  See also {karli}, {senta}, {snuji}, {vanbi}, se {nenri}, se {jbini}, {bartu}, {djine}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ assumes/supposes that $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true about subject $x_{3}$; [epistemology].
rows.n: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {smadi}, {birti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Sanskrit language/Sanskritic/Vedic culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ errs in doing/being/making mistake $x_{2}$ (event), an error under conditions $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ carries/hauls/bears/transports cargo $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ from $x_{4}$ over path $x_{5}$; $x_{1}$ is a carrier/[porter].
rows.n: Alienation from $x_2$ to $x_3$ is implied.  See also {marce}, {muvdu}, {benji}, {klama}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a blade/expanse of grass of species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to/is germane/relevant to/concerns/is related/associated with/is about $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a question of/treats of $x_2$; can be symmetric, although $x_1$ is conventionally more specific or constrained in scope than $x_2$.  See also cmavo list {ra'a}, {ckini}, {ponse}, {steci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Australian culture/nationality/geography/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [abrasive/cutting/scratching object/implement] scratches/[carves]/erodes/cuts [into] $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (cf. {guska}, {katna}, {mosra}, {plixa}, {kakpa} (unlike kakpa, sraku does not imply material is removed), {spali})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is vertical/upright/erect/plumb/oriented straight up and down in reference frame/gravity $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ spits/expectorates $x_{2}$ [predominantly liquid] from $x_{3}$ to/onto $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ answers/replies to/responds to person/object/event/situation/stimulus $x_{2}$ with response $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_3$ also answer/reply.  If $x_2$ is a person/object, it will usually require "tu'a" indicating that the reply/response is to that person/object doing something.  "tu'a" may not be needed if the person/object itself is the stimulus, rather than something it is doing. See also {cusku}, {preti}, {nabmi}, {danfu}, {frati}, {cpedu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ bursts/explodes/violently breaks up/decomposes/combusts into pieces/energy/fragments $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is broken/inoperable/broken down/non-utile/not usable for function $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Agentive break, cause to become inoperable (= {pofygau}, {pofyzu'e}); accidentally break, as a result of an event, non-agentive (= {pofyja'e}, {nutpo'uja'e}).  See also {daspo}, {katna}, {porpi}, {se} {xrani}, {cikre}, {conka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a hospital treating patient(s) $x_{2}$ for condition/injuries/disease/illness $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Hospice (a place where $x_2$ of spita is lenu {mrobi'o} = {mrospita}).  See also {bilma}, {mikce}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [object/substance] is a piece/portion/lump/chunk/particle of $x_{2}$ [substance].
$x_{1}$ is a tragedy/disaster/tragic for $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is married to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a spouse of $x_{2}$ under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the abdomen/belly/lower trunk [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: midsection].
rows.n: Also stomach (= {djaruntyrango}), digestive tract (= {befctirango}, {befctirangyci'e}).  See also {cutne}, {livga}, {canti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a plant/herb/greenery of species/strain/cultivar $x_{2}$.
