$x_{1}$ reflects Spanish-speaking culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Metaphorical restriction to Spain by contrast with xispo (comparable to the distinction between glico and merko/sralo/brito/kadno); Spain (= {sangu'e}); Spanish dialects spoken in Spain, especially Castillian (= {sansanbau}).  See also {xispo}, {ketco}, {mexno}, {gento}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) polishes object/surface $x_{2}$ with polish $x_{3}$, applied using tool $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/action abstract) surprises/startles/is unexpected [and generally sudden] to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an egg/ovum/sperm/pollen/gamete of/from organism [mother/father] $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (poorly metaphorical only due to gender- and species- being unspecified): ovoid, oblate (= {pevyso'aseltai}, but better: {claboi}); egg, specifically female (= {fetso'a}), of a bird (= {cpifetso'a}, {cpiso'a}), of a chicken (= {jipcyfetso'a}, {jipcyso'a}. (but note that Lojban does not require specificity, just as English doesn't for either milk or eggs; "sovda" is fine for most contexts); If fertilized, then {tsiju} or {tarbi}.  (cf. {ganti}, {gutra}, {mamta}, {patfu}, {rorci}, {tsiju}, {lanbi}, {tarbi}; also {djine}, {konju} for shape, {tarbi})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the brain [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: intelligence, mental control].
$x_{1}$ is to the north/northern side [right-hand-rule pole] of $x_{2}$ according to frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a son of mother/father/parents $x_{2}$ [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of sorghum of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a store/deposit/supply/reserve of materials/energy $x_{2}$ in containment $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_3$ need not be a container, but could merely be a site/location restriction; e.g. a heap.  The sumti indicates how the supply is identified and distinguished from other occurrences of the stored $x_2$ that are not part of the store.  (cf. {panka}; {vreji} for information storage; {sabji} for a store or reserve that is not necessarily tied to a site, {banxa}, {panka})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a knife (tool) for cutting $x_{2}$, with blade of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sack/bag with contents $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a soldier/warrior/fighter of army $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ sows/plants $x_{2}$ [crop/plants] at/in $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is the sun of home planet $x_{2}$ (default Earth) of race $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is solar.
rows.n: 'home planet' refers to a planet which is "home" to a race, but not necessarily the original "home" of a species if that species inhabits many worlds.  See also {gusni}, {lunra}, {mluni}, {plini}, {santa}, {terdi}, {tarci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of gold (Au); [metaphor: valuable, heavy, non-reactive].
$x_{1}$ transfers/sends/transmits $x_{2}$ to receiver $x_{3}$ from transmitter/origin $x_{4}$ via means/medium $x_{5}$.
rows.n: [also possibly "sharing"; no (complete) alienation from origin is implied]; [$x_5$ carrier]; (cf. {muvdu}, {dunda}, {mrilu}, {nirna}, {xruti}, {cradi}, {tivni}, {preja}, cmavo list {be'i}, {bevri}, {mrilu}, {tcana}).

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Bengali/Bangladesh culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Russian empire/USSR/ex-USSR (Soviet]/CIS culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a crew/team/gang/squad/band of persons $x_{2}$ directed/led by $x_{3}$ organized for purpose $x_{4}$.
rows.n: ($x_1$ is a mass; $x_2$ is a set completely specified); Also orchestra (= {zgibe'e}, {balzgibe'e}), outfit; $x_3$ conductor; business, not necessarily incorporated (= {cajbe'e}, {venbe'e}).  See also {gunma}, {girzu}, {dansu}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {kagni}, {kamni}, {minde}, {ralju}, {cecmu}, {gidva}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of a carbonated beverage/soda of flavor/brand $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also: soft drink (though this sometimes includes tea and coffee as distinct from alcoholic beverages which are "hard drinks").  See also {jilka}, {jinme}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali metal of type $x_{2}$ [default sodium].
rows.n: Also potassium, lithium, cesium.  Soda. See also {jilka}, {jinme}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects North American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of soya [grain/bean] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ fights/combats/struggles with $x_{2}$ over issue $x_{3}$ (abstract); $x_{1}$ is a fighter/combatant.
rows.n: Use $x_3$ tu'a for fight over an object/objective.  See also {bradi}, {gunta}, {talsa}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {jamna}, {sonci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is foolish/silly in event/action/property [folly] (ka) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a fool.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) is an accident/unintentional on the part of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an accident.
$x_{1}$ is secure/safe from threat $x_{2}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ is a sandwich/layering [not restricted to food] of $x_{2}$ sandwiched between $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ adheres/sticks to $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is sticky/gummy/adhesive.
rows.n: Note that $x_1$ is the adhering surface being claimed; $x_2$ need not be sticky.  See also {tarla}, {viknu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of snow.
$x_{1}$ is a drum/cymbal/gong [percussion musical instrument] with beater/actuator $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ seconds in duration (default is 1 second) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is to the south/southern side of $x_{2}$ according to frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Malay-Indonesian common language/culture in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [agent] succeeds in/achieves/completes/accomplishes $x_{2}$ as a result of effort/attempt/try $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ reaches $x_2$; (adjective:) $x_1$ is successful; $x_2$ (event/state/achievement).  See also {fliba}, {troci}, {jgira}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of barley [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a meaning/interpretation of $x_{2}$ recognized/seen/accepted by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a spoon/scoop (tool) for use $x_{2}$, made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sock/stocking [flexible foot and lower leg garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ hangs/dangles/is suspended from $x_{2}$ by/at/with joint $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Pendant (= {dadja'i}); also dependent (original meaning). See also {lasna}, {jorne}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a monkey/ape/simian/baboon/chimpanzee of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is the answer/response/solution/[reply] to question/problem $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (source) is quiet/silent/[still] at observation point $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ guesses/conjectures/surmises $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true about subject $x_{3}$; [epistemology].
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ has a hunch that $x_2$ is true; $x_1$ imagines $x_2$ is true; words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jijnu}, {sruma}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a mouse of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains onions/scallions of type/cultivar $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the muscle [body-part] controlling $x_{2}$, of body $x_{3}$; [metaphor: tools of physical power].
$x_{1}$ reflects Slavic language/culture/ethos in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sulfur/brimstone (S); [metaphor: foul odor, volcanic].
$x_{1}$ oscillates at rate/frequency $x_{2}$ through set/sequence-of-states $x_{3}$ (complete specification).
rows.n: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and from, back and forth, reciprocal (motion), rotates, revolves.  See also {dikni}, {rilti}, {morna}, {desku}, {janbe}, {boxna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is solid, of composition/material including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Conditions include temperature and pressure.  See also {runta}, {litki}, {gapci}, {jdari}, {dunja}, {pulce}, {jduli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains plastic/polymer of type/component unit(s) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is sour/tart to observer $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cylinder [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of acid of composition $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is acidic.
rows.n: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {slari}, {nimre}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a syllable in language $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is old/familiar/well-known to observer $x_{2}$ in feature $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: This can cover both meanings of old.  Old in years, i.e. age, can be conveyed through $x_2$ = the world, life, existence (= loi nu {zasti}); in usage this has been a common default for ellipsis.  However slabu is not the opposite of 'young' (= {nalci'o}, {tolci'o}), but the opposite of 'new' (= {tolni'o}); also ancient (= {tcesau}), age (= {nilsau}); $x_2$ is used to $x_1$ (= selsau for reordered places); historic/historical (= {cirsau}, {cirselcedra}; also {vaipru}).  (cf. {clani}, {citno}, {cnino}, se {djuno}; not the opposite of {citno}, {djuno})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a groove/trench/furrow [shape/form] in object/surface $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an animal/creature of species $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is biologically animate.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of smoke/smog/air pollution from source $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be a fire.  See also {pulce}, {gapci}, {sigja}, {bumru}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Gaelic/Scottish culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Irish (= {sicko'o}), Scottish (= {sunko'o}), Celtic (= {dzeko'o}), Welsh (= {nanko'o}), Breton (= {fasko'o}); since Scottish/Gaelic is only the northern branch of the Celtic tribes, many would prefer a fu'ivla for Celtic; nationalism might also demand a separate fu'ivla for Irish.  See also {brito}, {glico}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is cord/cable/rope/line/twine/cordage/woven strands of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cinema/movie/film about $x_{2}$ [plot/theme/subject/activity], filmmaker $x_{3}$, for audience $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also motion picture; $x_2$ may be a convention rather than a subject; cartoon/animation (= selxraci'a {skina}); television/tv show (= {tivyskina}, regardless of length, factual content, etc.).  See also {tivni}, {vidni}, {pixra}, {finti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a ski/skid/skate/runner for surface (of material) $x_{2}$ supporting skier/skater/sled/cargo $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ tells about/describes $x_{2}$ (object/event/state) to audience $x_{3}$ with description $x_{4}$ (property).
$x_{1}$ is/appears to be of color/hue $x_{2}$ as perceived/seen by $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Conditions may include lighting, background, etc..  See also {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {cinta}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xunre}, {zirpu}, {carmi}, {kandi}, {xekri}, {blabi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a pelt/skin/hide/leather from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a computer for purpose $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a skirt/kilt/dress of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is skirted [garment open at the bottom; not legged].
rows.n: A skirted garment may be full length ({pastu}), but must hang below the waist from support above or at the waist.  See also {taxfu}, {palku}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is private/personal/privy/[secret/confidential/confined] to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is not-public/hidden.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is secret (one sense); $x_2$ is in the know/in touch with/privy to $x_1$ (= {selsivni} for reordered places); exclusion can be expressed by na'e(bo) in $x_2$: excluded/in the dark (= {nalselsivni}).  See also {gubni}, {mipri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (force) puts pressure on/presses/applies force to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ cites/quotes/refers to/makes reference to source $x_{2}$ for information/statement $x_{3}$ (du'u).
$x_{1}$ (individual, mass) dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [agent] ceases/stops/halts/ends activity/process/state $x_{2}$ [not necessarily completing it].
$x_{1}$ seeks/searches/looks for property $x_{2}$ among set $x_{3}$ (complete specification of set).
rows.n: If searching for an object or an event, use tu'a in $x_2$.  See also {cirko}, {kalte}, {kavbu}, {kucli}, {rivbi}, {manci}, {facki}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Syrian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is straight/direct/line segment/interval between $x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$; (adjective:)  $x_{1}$ is linear.
$x_{1}$ is asleep (adjective); $x_{1}$ sleeps/is sleeping.
$x_{1}$ is a ballistic projectile [e.g. bullet/missile] for firing by [gun/propelling launcher] $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also cannonball, catapult stone, shot pellet(s).  See also {cecla}, {renro}, {jakne}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a sign/symbol/signal representing/referring/signifying/meaning $x_{2}$ to observer $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ signifies $x_2$; (adjective:) $x_1$ is significant/meaningful/of import; signal an action (= {sniti'i}), connotation (= se {sibyti'isni}, {sibyti'ismu}).  See also {lerfu}, {tcita}, {barna}, {mifra}, {smuni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the trigonometric sine of angle/arcsine $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ esteems/respects/venerates/highly regards $x_{2}$ [object of respect].
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ is respected/esteemed/celebrated (= {selsi'a} for reordered places).  See also {banli}, {censa}, {misno}, {nelci}, {prami}, {salci}, {jgira}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a snake/serpent of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (set) has members who mutually/reciprocally $x_{2}$ (event [$x_{1}$ should be reflexive in 1+ sumti]).
rows.n: Members of $x_1$ do to each other/one another $x_2$, and in return do $x_2$; $x_1$ (plural set) do the same thing $x_2$ to each other.  See also {kampu}, {mintu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is similar/parallel to $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni); $x_{1}$ looks/appears like $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a likeness/image of $x_2$; $x_1$ and $x_2$ are alike; similarity and parallel differ primarily in emphasis.  See also {dunli}, {frica}, {mintu}, {panra}, {simlu}, {vrici}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ seems/appears to have property(ies) $x_{2}$ to observer $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ seems like it has $x_2$ to $x_3$; suggest belief/observation (= {mlugau}, {mluti'i}); looks like/resembles (= {smimlu}, {mitmlu}).  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {simsa}, {zgana}, {ganse}, {jarco}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a portion/quantity of salt from source $x_{2}$, of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of silk produced by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an island/atoll/key of [material/properties] $x_{2}$ in surroundings/body $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is insular.
$x_{1}$ curses/damns/condemns $x_{2}$ to fate (event) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Curse with a specific expression (= {dapsku}).  See also {mabla}, {dimna}, {cnemu}, {sfasa}, {dunda}, {cusku}, {cirko}, {jdima}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a road/highway to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ with route $x_{4}$ ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$ may be unordered).
rows.n: A regularly used, improved-for-use surface for travelling.  See also {naxle}, {tcana}, {pluta}, {klaji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a cigar/cigarette/cigarillo made from tobacco/smokable substance $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ argues for stand $x_{2}$ against stand $x_{3}$; [an opponent is not necessary].
$x_{1}$ is far/distant from $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ helps/assists/aids object/person $x_{2}$ do/achieve/maintain event/activity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (idea abstract) is an idea/concept/thought about $x_{2}$ (object/abstract) by thinker $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is ideal/ideational.  See also {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {mucti}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {xanri}, cmavo list {si'o}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ shows audacity/chutzpah in behavior $x_{2}$ (event/activity); $x_{1}$ dares to do/be $x_{2}$ (event/ka).
$x_{1}$ is a coin/token/is specie issued by $x_{2}$ having value $x_{3}$ of composition including $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ [sound source] whistles/makes whistling sound/note/tone/melody $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ hits/strikes/[beats] $x_{2}$ with instrument [or body-part] $x_{3}$ at locus $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a pocket/pouch of/in garment/item $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ wears/is robed/garbed in $x_{2}$ as a garment of type $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ need not be intended for use as a garment (unlike taxfu).  See also {taxfu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ dives/swoops [manner of controlled falling] to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sofa/couch (noun).
$x_{1}$ (agent) punishes $x_{2}$ for infraction $x_{3}$ (event/state/action) with punishment $x_{4}$ (event/state).
rows.n: Also chastise, castigate, chasten, discipline, correct (one sense); also $x_4$ penalty.  See also {cnemu}, {pleji}, {venfu}, {zekri}, {canja}, {dunda}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}, {prali}, {dapma}, {cirko}, {jinga}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a fly [a small non-stinging flying insect] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a self/ego/id/identity-image of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) destroys/ruins/wrecks/despoils $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is destructive.
$x_{1}$ (agent) inserts/interposes/puts/deposits $x_{2}$ into interior $x_{3}$/into among/between members of $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Insertion need not imply a significant degree of 'filling'; inject (= {je'erse'a}); syringe/needle (= {se'arterje'e}, {je'erse'atci}, {jestu'u} or {tu'urjesni}); also pour, inflate, stuff, fill.  See also {rinci}, {tisna}, {punji}, {jbini}, {nenri}, {jmina}, {culno}, {kunti}, {catlu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a ribbon/tape/strip/band/stripe of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ are stairs/stairway/steps for climbing structure $x_{2}$ with steps $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a duck/[drake] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is apart/separate from $x_{2}$, separated by partition/wall/gap/interval/separating medium $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also aloof (= {jiksei}); alone (= {rolsmisei} meaning apart or unlike all others of its kind; {pavysei}, {seirpavmei} meaning "only" or "one alone" - do not use when talking about, for example, two people who are alone); $x_3$ space.  See also {bitmu}, {snuji}, {senta}, {fendi}, {curve}, {jinsa}, {bitmu}, {marbi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (du'u) [fact/measurement] is data/information/statistic(s) about $x_{2}$ gathered by method $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Evidence (= velji'i datni or just {velji'i}, {sidydatni}). See also {fatci}, {saske}, {vreji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ dreams about/that $x_{2}$ (fact/idea/event/state); $x_{2}$ is a dream/reverie of $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ is a layer/stratum [shape/form] of $x_{2}$ [material] within structure/continuum/composite $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ doubts/is dubious/doubtful/skeptical/questions that $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true.
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ is doubtful/dubious/questionable (= {selsenpi} for reordered places).  See also {jinvi}, {krici}, {djuno}, {birti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tenth [1/10; $10^{-1}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
rows.n: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

rows.d: $x_{1}$ sneezes (intransitive verb).
$x_{1}$ reflects Semitic [metaphor: Middle-Eastern] language/culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Semitic includes Arabic, Hebrew, Aramaic, and Ethiopian, among others.  See also {xrabo}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the language/dialect used by $x_{2}$ to express/communicate $x_{3}$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_{1}$ (agent) serves $x_{2}$ with service $x_{3}$ (activity); $x_{1}$ is a servant (noun) of $x_{2}$ performing $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cell/atom/unit/molecule of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an indivisible, most basic subunit of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: ($x_2$ generally has mass nature); (cf. {kantu} for properties, activities; {ratni}, {gradu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the finger/digit/toe [body-part] on limb/body site $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; [metaphor: peninsula].
$x_{1}$ owes $x_{2}$ in debt/obligation to creditor $x_{3}$ in return for $x_{4}$ [service, loan]; $x_{1}$ is a debtor.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) local volume unit(s) [non-metric; e.g. bushel], standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
rows.n: Gallon (= {likydekpu}), quart (= {likseldekpu}), barrel (wet = likybradekpu, dry = sudbradekpu), bushel (= {sudydekpu}), peck (= {sudyseldekpu}), cupful (= {kabrydekpu}), tablespoon (= {mucydekpu}); teaspoon (= {mucyxeldekpu}); (all of these lujvo may need gic- to distinguish the English measurement system in contrasting with some local system; the English system is otherwise presumed to be the default non-metric system).  (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {canlu}, {litce}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is surface/face [bounded shape/form] of [higher-dimension] object $x_{2}$, on side $x_{3}$, edges $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is ten [10; $10^1$ ] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ candela [metric unit] in luminosity (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bean/pea/leguminous seed from plant [legume] $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the tooth [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is dental.
$x_{1}$ operates/drives/runs $x_{2}$ [apparatus/machine] with goal/objective/use/end/function $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a noise/din/clamor [sensory input without useful information] to $x_{2}$ via sensory channel $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is dense/concentrated/packed/intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) at location/locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ awaits/waits/pauses for/until $x_{2}$ at state $x_{3}$ before starting/continuing $x_{4}$ (activity/process).
rows.n: ($x_2$ is an event, usually a point event); also: resuming $x_4$.  See also {dicra}, {fanmo}, {sisti}, {fliba}, {pandi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) strokes/rubs/pets $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [measurement/match] is exact/precise to precision $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ (mass of facts) is science of/about subject matter $x_{2}$ based on methodology $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Not limited to science as derived by the scientific method, but pertaining to any body of usually-coherent knowledge garnered/gathered/assembled by a consistent methodology.  See also {datni}, {fatci}, {djuno}, {cipra}, {pensi}, {jimpe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is harmonious/concordant/in agreement/concord with $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of dirt/soil/earth/ground from source $x_{2}$ of composition $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is earthen; $x_3$: composition including $x_3$, which need not be exhaustive of composition.  See also {kliti}, {terdi}, {loldi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a spiral/helix/whorl/[vortex] [shape/form] with limits $x_{2}$, of dimensionality $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ supports/holds up/is underpinning of/[helps] $x_{2}$ against force/opposition $x_{3}$ with/by means $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also aids; (adjective:) $x_1$ is dependable, reliable (such reliability may be transient; this is not the usual sense of 'reliable' or 'dependable'); ($x_2$ is object/event).  See also {bradi}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {sidju}, {tugni}, {bongu}, {ckana}, {cpana}, {loldi}, {sanli}, {selfu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (abstract) is necessary/required for continuing state/process $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also factually necessary, necessity, prerequisite, condition, precondition.  See also cmavo list {sau}, {nitcu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a heap/pile/stack/mound/hill of materials $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an umbrella/parasol shielding $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$, made of material $x_{4}$, supported by $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sauce/topping/gravy/frosting for use with $x_{2}$, containing ingredient(s) including $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_3$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component of sauce $x_1$.  See also {sanmi}, {mixre}, {stasu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (mass) is a meal composed of dishes including $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is a course/dish of meal $x_1$ (= {selsai} for reordered places).  See also {barja}, {stasu}, {gusta}, {sanso}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ stands [is vertically oriented] on surface $x_{2}$ supported by limbs/support/pedestal $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is standing; $x_1$ stands up; $x_1$ is erect/vertical/upright; $x_1$ bows/bends over (= {krosa'i}, {krosa'ibi'o}, {plosa'i}); frame of reference is (approximate) perpendicularity to the surface, and not to a gravity field.  See also {kamju}, {sraji}, {tuple}, {zbepi}, {sarji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is conscious/aware of $x_{2}$ (object/abstract); $x_{1}$ discerns/recognizes $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
rows.n: [also: $x_1$ knows Of. $x_2$ (one sense); awareness implies some amount of mental processing above and beyond mere sensory detection, and may also be applied to mental relationships that are not detected by the senses]; See also {menli}, {morji}, {ganse}, {sipna}, {cikna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ sings/chants $x_{2}$ [song/hymn/melody/melodic sounds] to audience $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Melody (= {sagzgi}, {ralsagzgi}), harmony (= {saxsagzgi}), harmonize/sing harmony (= {saxsa'a}), song (= {selsa'a}).  See also {pemci}, {rimni}, {rilti}, {siclu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is sound produced/emitted by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is simple/unmixed/uncomplicated in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cassava/taro/manioc/tapioca/yam [edible starchy root] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a quantity of salad [food] with ingredients/components including $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component of $x_1$.  See also {mixre}, {stasu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ shakes/quakes/trembles/quivers/shudders/wobbles/vibrates from force $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and fro, back and forth, reciprocal motion.  See also {slilu}, {janbe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is sloped/inclined/slanted/aslant with angle $x_{2}$ to horizon/frame $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also steep (= {tcesa'o}); normally implies non-rectilinear.  See also {kurfa}, {tutci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state $x_{2}$, at location $x_{3}$, by calendar $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (time units in $x_1$ are specified as numbers separated by pi'e or are unit values massified with joi); See also cmavo list {de'i}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {tcika}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] $x_{2}$ (object/event/process) due to quality $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ celebrates/recognizes/honors $x_{2}$ (event/abstract) with activity/[party] $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_3$ (and {nunsla}) festival/fiesta/celebration/occasion/fair/Holiday (some senses). Not limited to the ameliorative interpretation of 'celebrate': funeral (= {mrobixsla}).  See also {sinma}, {jbena}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of sugar [sweet edible] from source $x_{2}$ of composition $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also sucrose, fructose, glucose, galactose, lactose, etc.; saccharine/aspartame/sugar substitute ({basysakta} or {satybasti}, {ticysakta}); $x_3$: composition including $x_3$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {silna}, {titla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ slides/slips/glides on $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is slick/slippery to/for $x_1$ (= {selsakli} for reordered places).  See also {mosra}, {fulta}, {skiji}, {xutla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ sucks/is suction/vacuum/relatively low pressure of fluid/gas $x_{2}$ relative to high pressure $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also suck object/fluid (= {sakcpu} or {sakmuvgau}).  See also {cokcu}, {lacpu}, {flecu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is electricity [electric charge or current] in/on $x_{2}$ of polarity/quantity $x_{3}$ (def. negative).
rows.n: ($x_3$, a quantifier, can be expressed as a simple polarity using the numerals for positive and negative ma'u and ni'u); (explicitly) negative (= {dutydikca}), positive (= {mardikca}); current (= {selmuvdikca}, {muvdikca}; again default negative/electron current), charge (= {klodikca}, {stadikca}).  See also {lindi}, {xampo}, {flecu}, {maksi}, {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is local to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is confined to locus $x_{2}$ within range $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is regional
rows.n: Indicates a specific location/value within a range; e.g. a hits b.  What is the locality on b that a hits?  Thus $x_1$ is associated with a specific narrow region/interval $x_2$ of wider space/range $x_3$.  See also cmavo list {di'o}, {jibni}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {nenri}, {lamji}, {stuzi}, {tcila}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity $x_{2}$ with period/interval $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Saudi Arabian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quotient of '$x_{2}$/$x_{3}$' [dividend $x_{2}$ divided by divisor $x_{3}$], leaving remainder $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (me'o) is the [decimal/binary] equivalent of fractional $x_{2}$ (me'o) in base $x_{3}$ (quantity).
rows.n: Conversion from fractions to decimal-point based notation. See also {namcu}, {frinu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a match [incendiary device] made of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cabin of vehicle $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [source] provides/supplies/furnishes $x_{2}$ [supply/commodity] to $x_{3}$ [recipient].
$x_{1}$ is a cloud/mass of clouds of material $x_{2}$ in air mass $x_{3}$ at floor/base elevation $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fate/destiny of $x_{2}$; [doom, curse are mabla-forms]; $x_{2}$ is fated/predestined/doomed to $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ is a building/edifice for purpose $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a nail/tack [pointed driven/frictional fastener] of type/size $x_{2}$ (ka), made of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: ($x_2$ also can be ni abstraction); See also {pijne}, {lasna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an artifact; $x_{1}$ is artificial; $x_{1}$ is made/caused by people/se kulnu $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is man-made.
$x_{1}$ reflects Russian culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is measured in major-money-units (dollar/yuan/ruble) as $x_{2}$ (quantity), monetary system $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also pound, rupee, franc, mark, yen; $x_1$ is generally a price/cost/value.  See also {jdini}, {sicni}, {jdima}, {vecnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is dear/precious/darling to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is emotionally valued by $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydirba} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {tcika}, {kargu}, {vamji}, {vajni}, {pleji}, {jadni}, {jemna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ dissolves in solvent $x_{2}$ forming solution/[suspension] $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ melts [becomes liquid from solid state] at temperature $x_{2}$ and pressure $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ radiates/emits $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is rough/coarse/uneven/[grainy/scabrous/rugged] in texture/regularity.
$x_{1}$ is a drop [small, cohesive shape] of material [liquid/vapor] $x_{2}$ in surrounding material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is low/down/downward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also lower; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {cnita}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {farna}, {loldi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is weak/feeble/frail in property/quality/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of water; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is aqueous/[aquatic].
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal.
$x_{1}$ is a rose [flower - characterized by prickly stem/fragrance] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Roses are not all pink; avoid using for color rose, which might be {labyxu'e}.  See also {spati}, {xunre}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ desires/wants/wishes $x_{2}$ (event/state) for purpose $x_{3}$.
rows.n: If desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in $x_2$ (or use lujvo = {po'edji}).  See also {taske}, {xagji}, {mukti}, {nitcu}, {nelci}, {pacna}, {prami}, {rigni}, {trina}, {xebni}, {xlura}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is thick in dimension/direction $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; [relatively long in smallest dimension].
$x_{1}$ engenders/procreates/begets $x_{2}$ with coparent $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects European culture/nationality/geography/Indo-European languages in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, inside diam. $x_{3}$, outside diam. $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also ellipse, oval (= {jincla}); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops).  Also band, belt, encircle (= {jinsru}).  See also {clupa}, {cukla}, {dasri}, {karli}, {sovda}, {sruri}, {konju}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ knows fact(s) $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$ by epistemology $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= {tadjyju'o}). 'know/familiar with' - {se} {slabu}, {na'e} {cnino}, {na'e} {fange}. See also {du'o}, {krici}, {jinvi}, {cilre}, {certu}, {facki}, {jijnu}, {jimpe}, {senpi}, {smadi}, {kakne}, {birti}, {mipri}, {morji}, {saske}, {viska}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the daytime of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal (vs. nocturnal).
$x_{1}$ reflects German/Germanic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a highly reflective/polished non-tarnishing metallic surface, of metal $x_{2}$ [often chromium].
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains rock/stone of type/composition $x_{2}$ from location $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification. See also {kunra}, {jemna}, {canre}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a drama/play about $x_{2}$ [plot/theme/subject] by dramatist $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ with actors $x_{5}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may also be a convention. See also {finti}, {cukta}, {lisri}, {cfika}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is correct/proper/right/perfect in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka) in situation $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is something else.
$x_{1}$ is a roof/top/ceiling/lid of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (cf. {bitmu}, {stedu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {loldi}, {marbi}, {gacri}, {mapku}; a drudi is (designed to be) over/above something and shelters it from other things above the drudi, mapku)

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the logarithm of $x_{2}$ with base $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ avoids/evades/shuns/escapes/skirts [fate] $x_{2}$ (event) through action/state $x_{3}$ (event).
rows.n: Also detours around, stays away from; ($x_1$ is normally an object, but may be an event).  See also bandu which is not necessarily successful, {fanta}, which is agentive, se jersi which implies an opposing agent, {sisku}, {kalte}, {fapro}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an excess of/too much of $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rite/ceremony/ritual for purpose/goal $x_{2}$, by custom/in community $x_{3}$, with form/rules $x_{4}$.
rows.n: [also: $x_1$ is formal, Legal.  $x_1$ is 'going through the motions']; $x_4$ constraints/customs; See also {lijda}, {malsi}, {flalu}, {javni}, {tcaci}, {clite}, {junri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the heart [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [emotional/shape metaphors are NOT culturally neutral].
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of rice [a type of grain] of strain/cultivar $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a river of land mass $x_{2}$, draining watershed $x_{3}$ into $x_{4}$/terminating at $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a parent of/raises/rears $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ mentors/acts parental toward child/protege $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is polar opposite from/contrary to $x_{2}$ in property/on scale $x_{3}$ (property/si'o).
$x_{1}$ [member] is rare/unusual/uncommon/atypical in property $x_{2}$ (ka) among members of $x_{3}$ (set).
rows.n: ($x_3$ is complete specification of set); (cf. {cizra}, {fadni}, {cafne}, {kampu}, {cnano} - the generalized opposite to any/all of these concepts)

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [donor] gives/donates gift/present $x_{2}$ to recipient/beneficiary $x_{3}$ [without payment/exchange].
rows.n: Also grants; $x_3$ is a receiver (= {terdu'a} for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydu'a}, {posyseldu'a} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {benji}, {muvdu}, {canja}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {friti}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {cnemu}, {prali}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) greets/hails/[welcomes/says hello to]/responds to arrival of $x_{2}$ in manner $x_{3}$ (action).
rows.n: (cf. {friti} for welcome/hospitality, cmavo list {coi}, cmavo list {co'o})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event/state) effects/physically causes effect $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is a material condition for $x_2$; $x_1$ gives rise to $x_2$.  See also {gasnu}, {krinu}, {nibli}, te {zukte}, se {jalge}, {bapli}, {jitro}, cmavo list {ri'a}, {mukti}, {ciksi}, {xruti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is restrained/held [back]/constrained/kept by restraint $x_{2}$ against $x_{3}$ (event).
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ is a restraint/binding for $x_1$, $x_2$ keeps/restrains/holds [back]/constrains $x_1$ from $x_3$ (= {selri'u} for reordered places); agentive restraint (= {ri'urgau}, {ri'urzu'e}).  See also {zifre}, {ralte}, {pinfu}, {kavbu}, {fanta}, {jgari}, {jimte}, {bapli}, {curmi}, {kluza}, {tagji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ freezes/jells/solidifies at temperature $x_{2}$ and pressure $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ liquid/fluid drains/strains/flushes from source $x_{2}$ through drain/strainer $x_{3}$ by force $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ rhymes/alliterates with $x_{2}$ in language/phonetics $x_{3}$, matching sound correspondence $x_{4}$ (ka).
rows.n: Broad meaning of rhyme - any matching sound correspondence.  See also {pemci}, {sanga}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (sequence/non-text quote) is a rhythm/beat of music/expressive form $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Not necessarily oscillatory/regular pattern.  See also {damri}, {pemci}, {tonga}, {zgike}, {slilu}, {dikni}, {sanga}, {morna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of silver/argentum (Ag); [metaphor: valuable, tarnishing].
$x_{1}$ is anguished/distressed/emotionally wrought/stressed by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is repugnant to/causes disgust to $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is equal/congruent to/as much as $x_{2}$ in property/dimension/quantity $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Same in quantity/quality (not necessarily in identity); 'analogy' may be expressed as the equivalence of two properties of similarity (ka $x_1$ simsa $x_2$) and (ka $x_3$ simsa $x_4$). See also {du'i}, {satci}, {frica}, {simsa}, {mintu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is rich/wealthy in goods/possessions/property/aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is winter/wintertime [cold season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an elder/ancestor of $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/degree $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$'s generation precedes $x_{2}$'s parents.
$x_{1}$ reflects Antarctican culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ discovers/finds out $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject/object $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ finds (fi) $x_{3}$ (object).
$x_{1}$ [member] is ordinary/common/typical/usual in property $x_{2}$ (ka) among members of $x_{3}$ (set).
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ is a normal/common/ordinary/typical property among set $x_3$ (= selterfadni for reordered places); also regular, (mabla forms:) banal, trite, vulgar; ($x_3$ is complete set).  See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {tcaci}, {cnano}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a reptile of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fire/flame in fuel $x_{2}$ burning-in/reacting-with oxidizer $x_{3}$ (default air/oxygen).
$x_{1}$ survives/endures/undergoes/abides/lasts/persists through $x_{2}$ for interval/duration $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also lasts out, withstands; $x_1$ persists/lasts for duration $x_3$; (adjective:) $x_1$ is tough/durable.  See also {ranji}, {kuspe}, {randa}, {lifri}, {stali}, {temci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ throws/launches/casts/hurls $x_{2}$ to/at/in direction $x_{3}$ (propulsion derives internally to $x_{1}$).
$x_{1}$ is a human/human being/man (non-specific gender-free sense); (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is human.
$x_{1}$ is a sail for gathering propelling material $x_{2}$ on vehicle/motor $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an aunt/uncle of $x_{2}$ by bond/tie $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is an associated member of $x_{2}$'s parent's generation.
$x_{1}$ is a function/single-valued mapping from domain $x_{2}$ to range $x_{3}$ defined by expression/rule $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains meat/flesh from source/animal $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the tail/appendix [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: trailing, following portion/appendage].
$x_{1}$ is foreign/alien/[exotic]/unfamiliar to $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
rows.n: For the sense of alien (not from Earth), see {kesfange}. See also {cizra}, {jbena}, {ckini}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an end/finish/termination of thing/process $x_{2}$; [not necessarily implying completeness].
rows.n: $x_1$ is final/last/at the last; $x_1$ is a terminal/terminus of $x_2$; $x_1$ is the final/terminated state of terminated process $x_2$; $x_2$ terminates/ceases/stops/halts at $x_1$ (= {selfa'o} for reordered places).  See also {krasi}, {cfari}, {mulno}, {sisti}, {denpa}, {jipno}, {kojna}, {traji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a factory/foundry/industrial plant/mill producing $x_{2}$ from materials $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ prevents/keeps/stops/restrains/constrains event $x_{2}$ from occurring.
$x_{1}$ is an atom of element/atomic number $x_{2}$ of isotope number/atomic weight $x_{3}$.
rows.n: (cf. {kantu} for a basic unit of a property or activity; {selci} for a basic physical subunit, generally of a mass)

rows.d: $x_{1}$ translates text/utterance $x_{2}$ to language $x_{3}$ from language $x_{4}$ with translation result $x_{5}$.
rows.n: See also {cusku}, {bangu}. {traduki} is similar but has a different place structure.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a rat of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is natural/spontaneous/instinctive, not [consciously] caused by person(s).
$x_{1}$ [action] repeats/is repeated for a total of $x_{2}$ (quantity) occurrences.
$x_{1}$ (event) annoys/irritates/bothers/distracts $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also: is disruptive to.  See also {fengu}, {raktu}, {dicra}, {tunta}, {zunti}, {jicla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is ironic(al)/contrary to expectation $x_{2}$ in state/property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is soft/malleable/moldable/yielding to force $x_{2}$ in conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of bronze of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a myth/legend, a culturally significant story about $x_{2}$ in mythos $x_{3}$ of culture $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is mythical/fairy tale; used adjectivally for non-humanoid creatures (= {ramda'u}) of story/myth/legend/religion, e.g. dragon; fairy tale (= {veryranmi}).  See also {lijda}, {lisri}, {crida}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) $x_{2}$ (person/force ind./mass) about $x_{3}$ (abstract).
$x_{1}$ (event/state) continues/persists over interval $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ (property - ka) is continuous over $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the body organ [body-part] of body/species $x_{2}$ performing function $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ yields/gives way/surrenders to $x_{2}$ (force/agent) under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ retains/keeps/holds $x_{2}$ in its possession.
$x_{1}$ is principal/chief/leader/main/[staple], most significant among $x_{2}$ (set) in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
rows.n: Staple (= {ralselpra}); general/admiral/president/principal leader (= {ralja'a}, {ralterbe'e}; use additional terms to distinguish among these); also primary, prime, (adverb:) chiefly, principally, mainly; ($x_2$ is complete specification of set).  See also {vajni}, te {bende}, {minde}, {lidne}, {jatna}, {jitro}, {gidva}, {midju}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is delicate/fragile/subtle/refined in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
rows.n: Easily damaged or rendered less pleasing/pure/effective.  See also {jdari}, {ranti}, {tsali}, {milxe}, {kukte}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (object/person/event/situation) troubles/disturbs $x_{2}$ (person) causing problem(s) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also afflicts, is disruptive to, troublesome; $x_1$/$x_3$ are a care to $x_2$, $x_2$ is troubled by/cares about $x_1$/$x_3$ (= {selra'u} for reordered places).  See also {dicra}, {fanza}, {zunti}, {kurji}, {xanka}, {nabmi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Iraqi culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ falls/drops to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ in gravity well/frame of reference $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Note: things can fall in spin, thrust, or tide as well as gravity; (agentive "drop" = one of two lujvo: {falcru} and {falri'a}). See also {lafti}, {cpare}, {klama}, {sfubu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the direction of $x_{2}$ (object/event) from origin/in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is towards $x_1$ from $x_3$ (= {selfa'a} for reordered places).  See also {zunle}, {pritu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {cnita}, {dizlo}, {berti}, {snanu}, {stuna}, {stici}, {purci}, {balvi}, {lidne}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ develops/evolves towards/into $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ through stages $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is located across/on the other side of gap/boundary $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is opposite (fi) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is over there (across/beyond zo'e); directly across/beyond a boundary/gap, generally at the shortest plausible distance on the other side of the boundary.  See also {dukti}, {kuspe}, {bancu}, {kruca}, {cripu}, {pagre}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; $x_{1}$ is an incident/happening/occurrence.
$x_{1}$ is an affix/suffix/prefix/combining-form for word/concept $x_{2}$, form/properties $x_{3}$, language $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is a fact/reality/truth/actuality, in the absolute.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ radian(s) [metric unit] in angular measure (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Measured in degrees ({julra'o}); right ascension astronomical measurement. (= {cacryra'o}).  See also {jganu}, {kilto}, {centi}, {decti}, {dekto}, {femti}, {gigdo}, {gocti}, {gotro}, {gutci}, {litce}, {megdo}, {mikri}, {milti}, {minli}, {nanvi}, {petso}, {picti}, {terto}, {xatsi}, {xecto}, {xexso}, {zepti}, {zetro}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a rabbit/hare/[doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (action/activity/behavior) is sane/rational by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [sequence] is in reverse order from $x_{2}$ [sequence]; $x_{1}$ (object) is inverted from $x_{2}$ (object).
$x_{1}$ is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among $x_{2}$ with shares/portions $x_{3}$; ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$ fa'u).
rows.n: Also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= {fairgau}, {fairzu'e}). See also {fa'u}, {fendi}, {preja}, {katna}, {tcana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ boils/evaporates at temperature $x_{2}$ and pressure $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $10^{-15}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ (agent) divides/partitions/separates $x_{2}$ into sections/parts/ind. $x_{3}$ by method/partition $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is angry/mad at $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ (action/state/property).
$x_{1}$ is a powder of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a garden/tended/cultivated field of family/community/farmer $x_{2}$ growing plants/crop $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in the past of/earlier than/before $x_{2}$ in time sequence; $x_{1}$ is former; $x_{2}$ is latter.
rows.n: Time ordering only (use lidne otherwise); aorist in that $x_1$ may overlap in time with $x_2$ as long as it starts before, $x_1$ starts before $x_2$ but is continuing during $x_2$ (= {cfaprucabna}); non-aorist before, i.e. $x_1$ is over/ended before $x_2$ starts (= {fampru}), $x_1$ is completed before $x_2$ starts (= {mulpru}).  See also {lidne}, {balvi}, {cabna}, {farna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (action/event) is crazy/insane/mad/frantic/in a frenzy (one sense) by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a crack/fissure/pass/cleft/ravine/chasm/[defect/flaw] [shape/form] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a swelling/protrusion/convexity [shape/form] at/in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) puts/places/sets $x_{2}$ on/at surface/locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a pulley [tool] for performing action/function $x_{2}$ rotating on axle $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a police officer/[enforcer/vigilante] enforcing law(s)/rule(s)/order $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Police officer, as an agent of authority (= {ca'irpulji}, {ka'irpulji}), as part of a police force (= {puljysoi}, as part of {puljyselsoi}); military police (= {jempulji}, {bilpulji}).  See also {catni}, {sonci}, {bilni}, {flalu}, {bandu}, {jemna}, {zekri}, {krati}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is dust/precipitate [suspensible solid] from $x_{2}$ in medium/on surface $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ sews/stitches/sutures materials $x_{2}$ (ind./set) together with tool(s) $x_{3}$, using filament $x_{4}$.
rows.n: ($x_2$ if a set must be a complete specification); See also {cilta}, {jivbu}, {jorne}, {nivji}, {pijne}, {lasna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is measured in kopeck/cent money-subunits as $x_{2}$ [quantity], in monetary system $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also pfennig, paisa, sen, fen, dinar, etc.; $x_1$ is generally a price/cost/value.  (additional secondary, tertiary, etc. subunit places may be added as $x_4$, $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {sicni}, {jdini}, {jdima}, {vecnu}, {rupnu}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the lung [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: breathing/respiratory apparatus/bellows].
$x_{1}$ is fertile/conducive for supporting the growth/development of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is fruitful/prolific.
rows.n: Also fecund (note that the Lojban covers both potential and actual/realized fertility).  See also {vanbi}, {sidju}, {rorci}, {farvi}, {banro}, {cange}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is spiritual/pertains to the soul in nature [either energy or being]; $x_{1}$ is ghostly/ethereal.
$x_{1}$(s) is/are waste product(s) [left to waste] by $x_{2}$ (event/activity).
rows.n: Also shit, crap; agentive wasting (= {fesygau}, {fesyzu'e}).  See also {xaksu}, {kalci}, {pinca}.

rows.d: (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is elastic/springy.
$x_{1}$ is a process with inputs $x_{2}$, outputs/results $x_{3}$, passing through steps/stages $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ resource (= {selru'e}, but also {ru'etci}, (ru'er-/ruc- or selru'e-/selruc- modifying:) selxaksu, selsabji, livla).  See also cmavo list {pu'e}, {farvi}, {tadji}, {grute}, {tcini}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is prose about plot/theme/subject $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for intended audience $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Non-poetic written text, without intentional rhyme or meter; $x_2$ may be a convention rather than a subject.  See also {cfika}, {lisri}, {cukta}, {pemci}, {finti}.

rows.d: $x_1$ is a female/doe of species $x_2$ evidencing feminine physical/biological/genetic trait(s) $x_3$ (ka); $x_1$ is feminine.
rows.n: See also {nakni}. For culturally female traits, see {jikyfetsi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is to the right/right-hand side of $x_{2}$ which faces/in-frame-of-reference $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_3$ is the standard of orientation for $x_2$.  See also cmavo list {ri'u}, {mlana}, {crane}, {trixe}, {farna}, {zunle}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a print/impression/image on/in surface $x_{2}$ of/made by/using tool/press/implement/object $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is wise/sage about matter $x_{2}$ (abstraction) to observer $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (quoted text) is a question/query about subject $x_{2}$ by questioner $x_{3}$ to audience $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fig [fruit/tree] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a person/people (noun) [not necessarily human]; $x_{1}$ displays personality/a persona.
$x_{1}$ reflects Palestinian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ spreads/expands over/into $x_{2}$ from initial state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is perfect/ideal/archetypical/faultless/flawless/un-improvable in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ loves/feels strong affectionate devotion towards $x_{2}$ (object/state).
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is loving towards $x_2$, $x_1$ is a lover of $x_2$ (one sense), $x_2$ is beloved by $x_1$ (= {selpa'i} for reordered places).  See also {cinmo}, {xebni}, {nelci}, {djica}, {sinma}, {pluka}, {kurji}, {pendo}, {speni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a profit/gain/benefit/advantage to $x_{2}$ accruing/resulting from activity/process $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also (fe) $x_2$ profits from $x_3$ (= {selterprali} for reordered places); $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {selposprali} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {jinga}, {canja}, {sfasa}, {jerna}, {jdima}, {dunda}, {zivle}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a fish of species $x_{2}$ [metaphorical extension to sharks, non-fish aquatic vertebrates].
$x_{1}$ reflects Portuguese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [ordered set] is sequenced/ordered/listed by comparison/rules $x_{2}$ on unordered set $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is serial.  (sets are completely specified); See also cmavo list {po'i}, {lidne}, {liste}, {cmima}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ breaks/fractures/shatters/[splits/splinters/cracks] into pieces $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ invents/creates/composes/authors $x_{2}$ for function/purpose $x_{3}$ from existing elements/ideas $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is creative/inventive.  See also cmavo list {fi'e}, {ciska}, {pemci}, {zbasu}, {larcu}, specific works of authorship, {prosa}, {skina}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a law specifying $x_{2}$ (state/event) for community $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$ by lawgiver(s) $x_{5}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is a legality; $x_2$ is legal/licit/legalized/a legality (= {selfla} for reordered places).  See also {javni}, {ritli}, {zekri}, {pulji}, {tinbe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a flute/pipe/fife/recorder [flute-like/air-reed musical instrument].
$x_{1}$ possesses/owns/has $x_{2}$ under law/custom $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is owner/proprietor of $x_{2}$ under $x_{3}$.
rows.n: ($x_3$ is generally more important to the concept than commonly accepted for the English equivalent, since the concept is broader when unconstrained, and the nature/interpretation of possession/ownership is very culturally dependent); See also {ckini}, {ralte}, {jitro}, {steci}, {srana}, {tutra}, {turni}, {zivle}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Japanese culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Polynesian/Oceanian (geographic region) culture/nationality/languages in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (force) folds/creases $x_{2}$ at locus/loci/forming crease(s)/bend(s) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: For agentive folding (= {plogau}, {plozu'e}); use cardinal-value sumti in $x_3$, or rapli, to indicate multiple folds.  See also {korcu}, {cinje}, {boxfo}, {boxna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a current/flow/river of/in $x_{2}$ flowing in direction to/towards $x_{3}$ from direction/source $x_{4}$.
rows.n: [$x_1$ is a stream of $x_2$; $x_2$ is a fluid Gas or liquid. (= {selfle} for reordered places); $x_1$ flushes toward $x_3$; flush (= {caifle}, {sukfle})]; See also {rirxe}, {senta} where no directionality is implied, {rinci}, {xampo}, {dikca}, {sakci}, {gapci}, {litki}, {ciblu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ fails at doing $x_{2}$ (state/event); $x_{1}$ is a failure at its role in $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Baffled (= {pesfli}, {jmifli}, {dafspufli}, {menfli}, among other senses); also $x_2$ ceases/does not complete/fails to continue due to failure on the part of $x_1$.  See also {cfila}, {snada}, {srera}, {troci}, {sisti}, {ranji}, {denpa}, {bebna}, {zunti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the face [head/body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is facial.
$x_{1}$ is a field [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a broad uniform expanse of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also woods (= {ricfoi}), lawn/meadow (= {sasfoi}), brush (= {spafoi}, {cicyspafoi}).  See also {purdi}, {cange}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of foam/froth/suds of material $x_{2}$, with bubbles/vacuoles of material $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a route/path/way/course/track to $x_2$ from $x_3$ via/defined by points including $x_4$ (set).
rows.n: A route merely connects origin/destination, but need not be improved in any way; ($x_4$ is a set of points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly).  (cf. {litru}, {naxle}, {tcana}, {dargu}, {klaji}, ve {klama}; {tadji}, {zukte} for means to a goal, {klama}, {pagre})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a telephone transceiver/modem attached to system/network $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) seems pleasant to/pleases $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is complex/complicated/involved in aspect/property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) plows/furrows/tills [cuts into and turns up] $x_{2}$ with tool $x_{3}$ propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a plane [2-dimensional shape/form] defined by points $x_{2}$ (set); $x_{1}$ is flat/[smooth].
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is even/planar/level.  ($x_2$ is a set of points at least sufficient to define the plane); See also {xutla}, {sefta}, {tapla}, {karda}, {boxfo}, {pinta}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an apple [fruit] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent/object) leaps/jumps/springs/bounds to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ reaching height $x_{4}$ propelled by $x_{5}$.
rows.n: Place structure parallels klama; hence $x_4$ may be a route-like expression.  See also {bajra}, {stapa}, {cpare}, {lafti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a planet revolving around $x_{2}$ with planetary characteristics $x_{3}$, orbital parameters $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the pubic area/external genitalia [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pays/compensates/remunerates/[rewards] payment $x_{2}$ to recipient/payee $x_{3}$ for goods/services $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also $x_4$ commodities; $x_4$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posle'i}, {posyvelyle'i} for unambiguous semantics); rent (= {jerle'i}, {lejyjbera}).  (cf. {canja}, {cnemu}, {friti}, {kargu}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {prali}, {jerna}, {sfasa}, {dunda}, {jinga}, {dapma}; see note at jdima on cost/price/value distinction, {cirko}, {dirba})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) plans/designs/plots plan/arrangement/plot/[schematic] $x_{2}$ for state/process $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also invents/organizes; $x_2$ design, scheme; the structure or layout of an object would be represented as a state in $x_3$.  See also {cartu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is plump/fat/obese [excessively thick/bulbous/swollen] by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a picture/illustration representing/showing $x_{2}$, made by artist $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is pictorial/illustrative; drawing (= {xraselci'a}), $x_1$ draws $x_2$ (= xraci'a/xraci'a), image (= {xratai}), photo (= {kacmyxra}), take a photo (= {kacmyterxra}, {kacmyxragau}, {kacmyxrazu'e}); sculpture, relief (= {blixra}).  See also {ciska}, {cinta}, {prina}, {mupli}, {barna}, {skina}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a fork/fork-type tool/utensil for purpose $x_{2}$ with tines/prongs $x_{3}$ on base/support $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a button/knob/[handle] on/for item $x_{2}$, with purpose $x_{3}$, made of material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a piano/harpsichord/synthesizer/organ; a keyboard musical instrument.
$x_{1}$ bites/pinches $x_{2}$ on/at specific locus $x_{3}$ with $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is great/grand in property $x_{2}$ (ka) by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Indicates a subjective greatness, as compared to the objective standard implied for {barda}; (synonyms, possibly requiring tanru:) extraordinary, illustrious, magnificent, impressive, awesome, grandiose, august, inspiring, special, majestic, distinguished, eminent, splendor, stately, imposing (all generally {zabna}); terrible ({mabla}).  See also {barda}, {nobli}, {se} {sinma}, {pluja}, {misno}, {vajni}, {fasnu}, {cizra}, {traji}, {mutce}, {se} {manci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) drinks/imbibes beverage/drink/liquid refreshment $x_{2}$ from/out-of container/source $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is flat/level/horizontal in gravity/frame of reference $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a pencil/crayon/stylus applying lead/marking material $x_{2}$, frame/support [of material] $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also writing brush; $x_1$ stimulates substrate medium $x_2$ to display marks; explicitly denoting a standard lead pencil (= {tabypinsi}).  (cf. {ciska}, {penbi} (unlike the English equivalents, pinsi is the more general term over penbi), {burcu}, {bakri})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (text) is a comment/remark/observation about subject $x_{2}$ expressed by $x_{3}$ to audience $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_3$ comments/remarks/says $x_1$ about $x_2$ (= terselpinka for reordered places).  See also {jinvi}, {cusku}, {zgana}, {lanli}, {bacru}, {ciska}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the clitoris/penis [projecting reproductive organ; body-part] of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Normally context eliminates need for specificity; otherwise: penis (= {nakpinji}), clitoris (= {fetpinji}).  See also {cinse}, {gletu}, {vibna}, {plibu}, {vlagi}, {mabla}, {ganti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a prisoner/captive of $x_{2}$, restrained/held/confined by means/force $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is poor/indigent/impoverished/lacking in goods/possessions/property $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the urine/piss/pee of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the feather/plume(s)/plumage [body-part] of animal/species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ uses/employs $x_{2}$ [tool, apparatus, machine, agent, acting entity, material] for purpose $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also utilize; $x_2$ is useful/used productively by $x_1$ to do $x_3$ (= {selpli} for reordered places); hire/employ (= {le'ipli}, {lejyplicu'a}).  (cf. {tutci}, {cabra}, {minji}, {gasnu}, {zukte} for $x_2$, cmavo list {pi'o}, {sazri}, {jibri})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a crust/rind/peel/skin/hide/outer cover of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (cf. {grute}, {calku}, {skapi} (pilka as a general term includes skapi), {gacri})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the product/total/result of factors/multiplicands ($x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$) $x_{2}$ multiplied by $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a ticket entitling $x_{2}$ to entitlement/privilege $x_{3}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ replaces/substitutes for/instead of $x_{2}$ in circumstance $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a replacement/substitute.
$x_{1}$ emphasizes/accentuates/gives emphasis/stress/accent to $x_{2}$ by (action) $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ begs/pleads/supplicates/entreats/implores/beseeches/prays [asks with humility] $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also importune, petition, plea, solicit; $x_2$ benefactor, patron; $x_3$ boon, favor, gift, alms. See also {cpedu} which is more general as to manner, {pindi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a pin/peg (needle-shaped tool) for fastening to/piercing $x_{2}$, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is on the outside of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is exterior to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects French/Gallic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a trillionth [$10^{-12}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$(s) is a/are mark(s)/spot(s) on $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: {ba'armo'a} for a pattern of marks.  See also {sinxa}, {pixra}, {se} {ciska}, {se} {prina}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tavern/bar/pub serving $x_{2}$ to audience/patrons $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a leaf of plant $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is foliage of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ arches/curves over/around $x_{2}$ and is made of $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is an arch over/around $x_{2}$ of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also arc; $x_2$ need not be an object, but may be a point or volume.  See also {cripu}, {kruvi}, {korcu}, {condi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reacts/responds/answers with action $x_{2}$ to stimulus $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is responsive.
rows.n: $x_3$ stimulates $x_1$ into reaction $x_2$, $x_3$ stimulates reaction $x_2$ (= {terfra} for place reordering); attempt to stimulate, prod (= {terfratoi}, {tunterfratoi}).  See also {preti}, {danfu}, {spuda}, {cpedu}, {tarti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $10^{15}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is paste/pulp/dough/mash/mud/slurry [soft, smooth-textured, moist solid] of composition $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {marxa}, {kliti}, {tarla}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a pear [fruit] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ forgives $x_{2}$ for event/state/activity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is big/large in property/dimension(s) $x_{2}$ (ka) as compared with standard/norm $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ thinks/considers/cogitates/reasons/is pensive about/reflects upon subject/concept $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is thoughtful (one sense); $x_2$ is mental (one sense)/intellectual (one sense) (= {selpei}).  See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {jijnu}, {menli}, {morji}, {sidbo}, {jinvi}, se {nabmi}, {minra}, {lanli}, {besna}, {saske}, {skami}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ meets/encounters $x_{2}$ at/in location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ differs/is distinct from/contrasts with/is unlike $x_{2}$ in property/dimension/quantity $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also other-than (less common meaning).  See also {ranxi}, {drata}, {dunli}, {simsa}, {vrici}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is/acts as a friend of/to $x_{2}$ (experiencer); $x_{2}$ befriends $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) touches $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ [a locus on $x_{1}$ or an instrument] at $x_{4}$ [a locus on $x_{2}$].
$x_{1}$ is a pen using ink $x_{2}$ applied by process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a poem/verse about plot/theme/subject/pattern $x_{2}$ by author $x_{3}$ for intended audience $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be a convention rather than a subject.  See also {prosa}, {rimni}, {rilti}, {finti}, {lisri}, {sanga}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is yellow/golden [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is paper from source $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Sheet of paper (= {plekarda} if shape is important, {plebo'o}).  See also {karni}, {papri}, {prina}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [force] (ka) forces/compels event $x_{2}$ to occur; $x_{1}$ determines property $x_{2}$ to manifest.
rows.n: Also constrains; requires success, unlike the physics term (better expressed by {danre}).  See also {fanta}, {rinju}, {jimte}, {jitro}, {rinka}, {krinu}, {zukte}, {randa}, {danre}, cmavo list {bai}, {marxa}, {tinsa}, {xarnu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects African culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (action) is easy/simple/facile for $x_{2}$ (agent) under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{2}$ does $x_{1}$ freely/easily.
$x_{1}$ is a fraction, with numerator $x_{2}$, denominator $x_{3}$ ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$).
$x_{1}$ offers/proffers $x_{2}$ [offering] to $x_{3}$ with conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: ($x_4$ may be nu canja, nu pleji, etc.; an unconditional offering has the 'condition' of acceptance); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posfriti}, {posyselfriti} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {canja}, {dunda}, {rinsa}, {vecnu}, {jdima}, {cnemu}, {pleji}, {vitke}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ frowns/grimaces (facial expression).
rows.n: $x_1$ frowns/grimaces at/in reaction to $x_2$ (= {frufra}).  See also {cmila}, {cisma}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a copy/replica/duplicate/clone of $x_{2}$ in form/medium $x_{3}$ made by method $x_{4}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ (passive) floats on/in fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is buoyant.
$x_{1}$ (event/property) is determined by the luck/fortune of $x_{2}$; (note mabla/zabna not implied). $x_{1}$ is determined by chance.
$x_{1}$ is a pot/kettle/urn/tub/sink, a deep container for contents $x_{2}$, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a potato [an edible tuber] of variety/cultivar $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (use samcu for starchy/tuberous roots that do not reproduce from eyes of tuber); See also {genja}, {jalna}, {samcu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a father of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ begets/sires/acts paternal towards $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is a robe/tunic/gown/cloak/dress/[coveralls] [a long/full body garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ rots/decays/ferments with decay/fermentation agent $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is rotten/decayed/fermented.
$x_{1}$ is responsible/accountable for $x_{2}$ (action/resulting state) to judge/authority $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (me'o, fraction) is a ratio/rate of $x_{2}$ (quantity) with respect to $x_{3}$ (quantity), [$x_{2}$:$x_{3}$].
rows.n: Also $x_1$ fraction/proportion/quotient; $x_2$ dividend/numerator; $x_3$ divisor/denominator.  See also {frinu}, {dilcu}, {mekso}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a [physical] page/leaf of book/document/bound mass of pages $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Numbered pages (as in a book) are the sides of a page (= {paprysfe}, {paprysfelai}); a pageful of text (= {papryseltcidu}, {paprytcidylai}).  See also {karni}, {pelji}, {prina}, {xatra}, {vreji}, {pezli}, {cukta}, {ciska}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an article/descriptor labelling description $x_{2}$ (text) in language $x_{3}$ with semantics $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu.  'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a [biological] offspring/child/kid/hybrid of parent(s) $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is filial.
$x_{1}$ protests/objects to/complains about $x_{2}$ (event/state) to audience $x_{3}$ with action $x_{4}$.
rows.n: ($x_4$ is an event or {tu'a} quotation) See also {xarnu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ parallels $x_{2}$ differing only in property $x_{3}$ (ka; jo'u/fa'u term) by standard/geometry $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is parallel to $x_2$, $x_3$ is the only difference between $x_1$ and $x_2$ (= {terpanra} for reordered places); $x_1$ and $x_2$ are alike/similar/congruent.   A parallel involves extreme close similarity/correspondence across the entirety of the things being compared, generally involving multiple properties, with focus placed on one or a small number of differences. See also {pa'a}, {mintu}, {simsa}, {girzu}, {vrici}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is at peace with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a slice [thin flat portion] of $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ is a park/land reserve managed by community/polity/company $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sponge/porous material.
rows.n: Also metaphorically used for coral, Swiss cheese.  See also {cokcu} for a generalized absorbant.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) punctuates $x_{2}$ (expression) with symbol/word $x_{3}$ with syntactic/semantic effect $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is an odor/fragrance/scent/smell emitted by $x_{2}$ and detected by observer/sensor $x_{3}$.
rows.n: An undetected emitter is odorless to the observer.  See also {nazbi}, {sumne}, {cpina}, {vrusi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) modifies/alters/changes/transforms/converts $x_{2}$ into $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Causal, resultative change; agentive modification (= {gafygau}, {gafyzu'e}).  (cf. {stika} for non-resultative, {binxo} for not-necessarily causal change, {cenba} for non-resultative change; {zasni})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a pump/injector [tool/apparatus] pumping/inserting fluid $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ from $x_{4}$ by means $x_{5}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ fluid may be liquid or gas; $x_5$ may be a force; a pump generally causes a pressure gradient, such that $x_3$ is a place of lower pressure, $x_4$ a place of higher pressure.  (cf. {gapci}, {litki}, {rinci}; metaphorical use of {fepri} for gas, {risna} for liquid, {rinci}, {tutci})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a plate/dish/platter/saucer [flat/mildly concave food service bed] made of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is high/up/upward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also upper; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself.  See also {gapru}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {drudi}, {farna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a tray/platter/flat container [pan/sheet/griddle] of contents $x_{2}$, and made of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also pallet, when used for carrying rather than support on the ground; a tray is flat-bottomed and shallow or without a rim, and is generally portable.  See also {tansi}, {patxu}, {palta}, {ckana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the throat/gullet [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: narrow(ing) opening of a deep hole].
$x_{1}$ are pants/trousers/slacks/leggings [legged garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is evil/depraved/wicked [morally bad] by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ judges/referees/arbitrates/is a judge determining/deciding matter $x_{2}$ (abstract).
rows.n: $x_2$ includes jei = rule ({jetpai}), ni = estimate ({lairpai}), ka = evaluate ({kairpai} or {vampai}), or nu = referee/arbitrate ({faurpai}); single events of judging including specific decisions/judgements (= {paijdi}, {jetpaijdi}, {lairpaijdi}, {kairpaijdi}, {vampaijdi}, {faurpaijdi}); jury (= {pairkamni}), serve on a jury (= {kamnypai}, as part of mass $x_1$).  See also {cuxna}, {jdice}, {vajni}, {cipra}, {zekri}, {manri}, {mansa}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is closed/shut/not open, preventing passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$ (something being blocked).
rows.n: As a doorway, but also perhaps a semi-permeable membrane. $x_{3}$ is blocked by $x_{1}$. $x_{2}$ is inaccessible. See also {kalri}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}, {zunti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is broad/wide in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ passes through/penetrates barrier/medium/portal $x_{2}$ to destination side $x_{3}$ from origin side $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Passing through in both directions (= rolfargre, pagre ... .i so'ivo'ivo'u (and vice versa)).  See also {bitmu}, {denci}, {ganlo}, {kalri}, {vorme}, {pluta}, {canko}, {ragve}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a part/component/piece/portion/segment of $x_{2}$ [where $x_{2}$ is a whole/mass]; $x_{2}$ is partly $x_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ [observer] senses/detects/notices stimulus $x_{2}$ (object/nu) by means $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ is sensitive to $x_2$; also feels, spots, perceives, makes out, discerns/recognizes (but only implying reaction without necessarily any significant mental processing); note that the emphasis is on a property which stimulates $x_1$ and is detected (sanji is passive about the sensing, and is not limited to sensory input, as well as presuming some kind of discernment/recognition, while not being concerned with the means of detection); $x_3$ sense/sensory channel.  See also {pencu}, {sanji}, {viska}, {sumne}, {tirna}, {zgana}, {canci}, {simlu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ hopes/wishes for/desires $x_{2}$ (event), expected likelihood $x_{3}$ (0-1); $x_{1}$ hopes that $x_{2}$ happens.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is hopeful of $x_2$; $x_2$ will hopefully occur, as hoped for by $x_1$; the value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether pacna means 'hope' or 'wish' or 'expect': hoping for objects/states with negligible expectation is "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is "hoping"; when the probability is subjectively near 1, the attitude is described as "expecting"; the value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); wish (= {sotpa'a}), hope (= {sorpa'a}), expect (= {sojypa'a}).  See also {djica}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the testes/ovary/testicle/scrotum/balls/gonad/stamen/pistil [body-part] of $x_{2}$, gender $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the anus/anal orifice/asshole/arsehole [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: exit, waste exit].
rows.n: Also asshole/ass/arsehole; (adjective:) $x_1$ is anal.  See also {zargu}, {kalci}, {mabla}, {rinci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ organizes $x_{2}$ [relative chaos] into $x_{3}$ [ordered/organized result] by system/principle(s) $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_3$ is also a system; $x_4$ could be merely a function which inherently serves to dictate the organizational structure of $x_3$.  See also {ciste}, {morna}, {stura}, {bilni}, {cabra}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is gaseous/fumes/a gas/vapor of material/composition including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_3$ includes temperature and pressure.  See also {pambe}, {vacri}, {litki}, {sligu}, {danmo}, {bumru}, {cidro}, {flecu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is directly/vertically above/upwards-from $x_{2}$ in gravity/frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rail/railing/bar [tool] supporting/restraining $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ does/brings about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains steel of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a root [body-part] of plant/species $x_{2}$; [metaphor: immobile, supporting, nourishing].
$x_{1}$ reflects Argentinian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a hook/crook [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is news/tidings/new information about subject $x_{2}$ from source $x_{3}$, to observer $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a dog/canine/[bitch] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is neutral/not taking sides/medial/not towards any extreme on scale/in dissension $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also $x_2$ dispute/struggle (though $x_2$ is not limited to disagreements, which is merely one manifestation of scalar or distributed values in which there is a medial position).  See also {midju}, {lanxe}, {milxe}, {mutce}, cmavo list {no'e}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the grammar/rules/defining form of language $x_{2}$ for structure/text $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object) suffices/is enough/sufficient for purpose $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rural/rustic/pastoral area of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is in the country.
$x_{1}$ (agent) promises/commits/assures/threatens $x_{2}$ (event/state) to $x_{3}$ [beneficiary/victim].
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) guides/conducts/pilots/leads $x_{2}$ (active participants) in/at $x_{3}$ (event).
rows.n: A guiding person advises/suggests/sets an example to be followed, but does not necessarily control/direct/manage actual execution of an event; an event may serve as a guide by setting a pattern/example to be emulated.  See also {jitro}, {ralju}, {sazri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {fukpi}, {morna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a billion [British milliard] [$10^9$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a camp/encampment/temporary residence of $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is magenta/fuchsia/purplish-red [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is group/cluster/team showing common property (ka) $x_{2}$ due to set $x_{3}$ linked by relations $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also collection, team, comprised of, comprising; members $x_3$ (a specification of the complete membership) comprise group $x_1$; cluster (= {kangri}).  See also {bende}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {gunma}, {panra}, {cabra}, {cecmu}, {kansa}, {klesi}, {lanzu}, {liste}, {vrici}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a (Lojban) root word expressing relation $x_{2}$ among argument roles $x_{3}$, with affix(es) $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Gismu list, if physical object (= ({loi}) {gimste}); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new gismu to the gismu list = {gimpoi}, {gimselcmi}, {gimselste}).  See also {cmavo}, {cmene}, {lujvo}, {smuni}, {sumti}, {tanru}, {valsi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is hot/[warm] by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is happy/merry/glad/gleeful about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ copulates/mates/has coitus/sexual intercourse with $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ and $x_2$ are symmetrical; mounts (= {cpanygle}). Note that the word "gletu" lacks the taboo associated with some of its English gloss words, or any of the various English slang uses. See also {cinse}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}, {mabla}, {speni}.
rows.g: copulate;fuck;have sexual intercourse with;have sex with

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is English/pertains to English-speaking culture in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Generally assume broadest sense of 'English'; may refer to 'English', pertaining to the country/people/culture of England (normally requiring constraint = gligu'e, or simply redundancy = gligli-); British English, the norm language of the UK (= {gliglibau}).  (cf. {brito} which refers to the United Kingdom as a whole or to the British empire, {merko}, {sralo}, {kadno}, {skoto})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a message/notice/memorandum about subject $x_{2}$ from author $x_{3}$ to intended audience $x_{4}$.
