rows.n: Emphasis on brevity, single or identifiable subject (contrast with xatra: the emphasis in notci is on the single or cohesively focused subject, while the audience is less defined - indeed only an 'intended' audience.  xatra need not have a single or focussed subject - its corresponding place is for 'content'); reminder/memo/note (= {mojnoi}).  See also {xatra}, {nuzba}, {mrilu}, {morji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $10^{-24}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is $10^{24}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ [magnitude] is a unit/degree of/on scale/reference standard $x_{2}$ (si'o) measuring property $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also grade, level, point; $x_3$ dimension.  See also {ckilu}, {kantu}, {kelvo}, {merli}, {ranti}, {selci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ gram(s) [metric unit] in mass (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a rod/pole/staff/stick/cane [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains grease/fat/oil from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a frame/structure/skeleton/outline supporting/load-bearing/determining the form of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is noble/aristocratic/elite/high-born/titled in/under culture/society/standard $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also upper-class; high/low, upper/lower are poor Lojban metaphors; note $x_2$ standard applies when the title/nobility is not recognized culture/society wide; this would include self-assumed titles.  See also {banli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is gray [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a fruit [body-part] of species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a girl [young female person] of age $x_{2}$ immature by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use verba).  See also {nanla}, {verba}, {ninmu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) knits $x_{2}$ [cloth/object] from yarn/thread $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is public/un-hidden/open/jointly available to/owned by all among community $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ needs/requires/is dependent on/[wants] necessity $x_{2}$ for purpose/action/stage of process $x_{3}$.
rows.n: No implication of lack.  See also {banzu}, {cidja}, {claxu}, {pindi}, {xebni}, {sarcu}, {lacri}, {djica}, {taske}, {xagji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a nerve/neuron [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: information/control network connection].
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is neural.  See also ve {benji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the country of peoples $x_{2}$ with land/territory $x_{3}$; (people/territory relationship).
rows.n: Also sovereignty, domestic (as opposed to foreign), nation (when not referring to ethnos).  See also {turni}, {natmi}, {jecta}, {tumla}, {tutra}, {lanci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a woman/women; $x_{1}$ is a female humanoid person [not necessarily adult].
rows.n: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use remna or prenu).  See also {nanmu}, {remna}, {prenu}, {makcu}, {nixli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of citrus [fruit/tree, etc.] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [furniture items] furnishes $x_{2}$ [location] serving purpose/function $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of nickel/other metal resistant to oxidation.
$x_{1}$ is industry/industrial/systematic manufacturing activity producing $x_{2}$ by process/means $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [person] labors/works on/at $x_{2}$ [activity] with goal/objective $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a worker/laborer.  (cf. {sazri}, {gasnu}, {se} {jibri}; {zukte} - which need not be labor; physics term 'work' = {ni} {muvyselbai}, {briju}, {jibri}, {lazni}, {selfu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a nighttime of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is at night/nocturnal.
rows.n: Tonight (= {cabycte}); tomorrow night (= {bavlamcte}, even when tonight is still in the future); last night (= {prulamcte}).  See also {donri}, {djedi}, {tcika}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a mass/team/aggregate/whole, together composed of components $x_{2}$, considered jointly.
rows.n: A description in $x_1$ indicates of mass property(ies) displayed by the mass; masses may reveal properties not found in the individual set members that are massified, which themselves are not necessarily relevant to the mass property implicit in this bridi.  See also {bende}, {girzu}, {pagbu}, cmavo list {loi}, {lei}, {lai}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {kansa}, {tinci}, {mulgunma}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ logically necessitates/entails/implies action/event/state $x_{2}$ under rules/logic system $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ rolls/trundles on/against surface $x_{2}$ rotating on axis/axle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a roller.
$x_{1}$ is a goose/[gander] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/mass) attacks/invades/commits aggression upon victim $x_{2}$ with goal/objective $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is grain/[British: corn]/cereal from plant/species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ blade/scraper/erosive scrapes/erodes/abrades $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is in/inside/within $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is on the inside/interior of $x_{2}$ [totally within the bounds of $x_{2}$].
rows.n: Indicates total containment.  (cf. se {vasru} (for containment that need not be total), {jbini}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {sruri}, {senta}, {snuji}, {bartu}, {diklo}, {jibni}, {jinru}, {setca})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is fond of/likes/has a taste for $x_{2}$ (object/state).
$x_{1}$ is energy of type $x_{2}$ in form $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ [energy] is light/illumination illuminating $x_2$ from light source $x_3$.
rows.n: [$x_3$ illuminates/lights $x_2$ with light/illumination $x_1$; $x_2$ is lit/illuminated by illumination $x_1$ from source $x_3$ (= {selgu'i} for reordered places); light/lamp (= {tergu'i})](cf. {dirce}, {manku}, {solri}, {carmi}, {ctino}, {kantu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a restaurant/cafe/diner serving type-of-food $x_{2}$ to audience $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) short local distance unit(s) [non-metric], standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
rows.n: Foot (= {jmagutci}); yard (= {cibjmagutci}), pace (= {tapygutci}), inch (= {degygutci}), cubit (= {birgutci}).  (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the womb/uterus [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: nourishing, protective, giving birth].
$x_{1}$ is the nose [body-part] of $x_{2}$ with nostril(s)/nasal passage(s) $x_{3}$; [metaphor: protrusion].
$x_{1}$ is a canal/channel to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ with route $x_{4}$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of noble gas of type $x_2$ [helium/neon/argon/krypton/xenon/radon].
$x_{1}$ is a melon/squash [fruit/plant] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ brakes/causes to slow motion/activity $x_{2}$ with device/mechanism/principle $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a nation/ethnic group of peoples $x_{2}$; [people sharing a history/culture].
$x_{1}$ (du'u) contradicts/denies/refutes/negates $x_{2}$ (du'u) under rules/logic $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also exception (= {nafmupli}); agentive contradict/deny (= {nafxu'a} or {tolxu'a}).  See also {nibli}, {tugni}, {zanru}, {xusra}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is orange [color adjective].
$x_{1}$ is a nut [body-part: hard-shelled fruit] from plant/species $x_{2}$ with shell $x_{3}$ and kernel $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also $x_4$ nucleus, center (= {velnarge} for place reordering).  See also {grute}, {stagi}, {jbari}, {midju}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (object) adorns/decorates $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an adornment/decoration of $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is fancy/decorated.
$x_{1}$ is a billionth/thousand-millionth [$10^{-9}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a man/men; $x_{1}$ is a male humanoid person [not necessarily adult].
rows.n: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use remna or prenu).  See also {ninmu}, {remna}, {prenu}, {makcu}, {nanla}, {bersa}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a boy/lad [young male person] of age $x_{2}$ immature by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use verba).  See also {nixli}, {verba}, {nanmu}, {bersa}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is difficult/hard/challenging for $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ challenges (non-agentive) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ years in duration (default is 1 year) by standard $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is annual.
rows.n: This year (= {cabna'a}); next year (= {bavlamna'a}); last year (= {prulamna'a}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains bread [leavened or unleavened] made from grains $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (li) is a number/quantifier/digit/value/figure (noun); refers to the value and not the symbol.
$x_{1}$ is a rocket [vehicle] propelled by jet expelling $x_{2}$ carrying payload $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (action/event/state) is a result/outcome/conclusion of antecedent $x_{2}$ (event/state/process).
rows.n: Also: $x_2$ gives rise to $x_1$ (= selja'e for reordered places); total (general meaning, but also = mekyja'e, pi'irja'e, sujyja'e).  See also se {mukti}, te {zukte}, se {rinka}, se {krinu}, se {nibli}, {mulno}, {sumji}, {pilji}, {mekso}, cmavo list {ja'e}, {ciksi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the wing [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: lateral supporting surface].
$x_1$ is a male/buck of species $x_2$ evidencing masculine physical/biological/genetic trait(s) $x_3$ (ka); $x_1$ is masculine.
rows.n: See also {fetsi}, {bersa}. For culturally male traits, see {jikynakni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of starch from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cockroach/orthopteran/termite of order/species/breed $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also grasshopper (= {pipyjalra});  cricket (= {sagjalra}); locust, termite (= {mantyjalra} or {mudyctijalra}).  (Orthoptera includes grasshoppers, crickets, etc; termites are a closely-related non-Orthoptera, more akin to cockroaches than to e.g. ants); See also {cinki}, {civla}, {manti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the foot [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: lowest portion] (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is pedal.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) is a problem to/encountered by $x_{2}$ in situation/task/inquiry $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ requires consideration by $x_2$.  See also {preti}, {danfu}, {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {jinvi}, {nandu}, {pensi}, {sidbo}, {spuda}, {raktu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (person/mass) wars against $x_{2}$ over territory/matter $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is at war with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bell/chime/[tuning fork] [tuned percussion instrument] producing sound/note $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ rings/tolls (i.e. if it rings, then it is a bell); resonates (one sense, = {jabdesku}).  See also {zgike}, {tonga}, {desku}, {slilu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the shoulder/hip/joint [body-part] attaching limb/extremity $x_{2}$ to body $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a museum for preserving [and possibly exhibiting] $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object) moves to destination/receiver $x_{2}$ [away] from origin $x_{3}$ over path/route $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also mobile (= {comymu'u}, for the non-specific opposite of immobile); after a muvdu, object is alienated from/no longer at origin (unless physically returned there, per litru or slilu); agentive move (= {muvgau}, {muvzu'e}), non-agentive transitive move (= {muvri'a}), self-propelled (= {sezmuvgau}), motion of a part of the object (= {pagmu'u}), having a moving part (= {muvypau}, {muvyselpau}); apparent motion (= {mlumu'u}).  (cf. {rinci}, {klama} (which differs in that the means of motion is explicit), {litru}, {cliva}, {fatri}; {dunda}, {benji} for agentive movement that does not necessarily imply alienation from origin, preja for similar movement with no agent implied, {bevri}, {vimcu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ collides with/crashes/bumps/runs into $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (also collide = {simjanli} for a collision between two moving objects); See also {darxi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is much/extreme in property $x_{2}$ (ka), towards $x_{3}$ extreme/direction; $x_{1}$ is, in $x_{2}$, very $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also very, a lot, immoderate/immoderately, pretty, intense, quite, extremely.  See also {milxe}, {traji}, {banli}, {carmi}, {nutli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ pertains to the Islamic/Moslem/Koranic [Quranic] culture/religion/nation in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a curtain/blinds/drapes for covering/obscuring aperture $x_{2}$, and made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is the [astronomical] twilight/dawn/dusk/half-light/glimmering of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Morning twilight, dawn (= {cermurse}); evening twilight, dusk (= {vacmurse}).  See also {cerni}, {kandi}, {vanci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an example/sample/specimen/instance/case/illustration of common property(s) $x_{2}$ of set $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a diplomat/consul representing polity $x_{2}$ in/at negotiation $x_{3}$ for function/purpose $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (for) $x_3$ polity, (use tu'a); also ambassador (= {raljansu}, {trujansu}).  See also {jecta}, {krati}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a universe/cosmos [complete and ordered entirety] of domain/sphere $x_{2}$ defined by rules $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also world; a universe is a kind of system, one which comprehensively encompasses its domain; e.g. 'universe of discourse', or 'world of birds'; $x_3$ are the rules/defining principles which distinguish the universe from other universes, or from non-universe.  See also {ciste}, {plini}, {kensa}, {mulno}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) is complete/done/finished; $x_{1}$ (object) has become whole in property $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also perfected, entirety; (adverb/adjective:) entire, total, integral, fully, totally, wholly, completely, entirely.  See also {fanmo}, {culno}, {pagbu}, {xadba}, {prane}, {jalge}, {sumji}, {munje}, {sisti}, {xadni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (action/event/state) motivates/is a motive/incentive for action/event $x_{2}$, per volition of $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also; $x_3$ is motivated to bring about result/goal/objective $x_2$ by $x_1$ (= {termu'i} for reordered places); (note that 'under conditions' BAI may apply and be appropriately added to the main predicate level or within the $x_2$ action level).  (cf. cmavo list {mu'i}, {nibli}, te {zukte} - generally better for 'goal', se {jalge}, {krinu}, {rinka}, {ciksi}, {djica}, {xlura})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an account/bill/invoice for goods/services $x_{2}$, billed to $x_{3}$ by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a suburban area of city/metropolis $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains wood/lumber from tree(s) of type/species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is immaterial/not physical/without material form.
$x_{1}$ (agent) shows/exhibits/displays/[reveals]/demonstrates $x_{2}$ (property) to audience $x_{3}$.
rows.n: [reveal (= {tolmipygau}, {mipyja'o}, {sivja'o}); also: $x_1$ shows that $x_2$, $x_1$ shows off $x_2$; Use {arco} for displaying objects.; See also {tigni}, {cipra}, {zgana}, {jvinu}, {lanli}, {mipri}, {simlu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is narrow in dimension $x_{2}$ [2nd most significant dimension] by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ [tool] is a hammer for/hammers $x_{2}$ [target] consisting of weight/head $x_{3}$ propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ mails/posts [transfer via intermediary service] $x_{2}$ to recipient address $x_{3}$ from mailbox/post office/sender address $x_{4}$ by carrier/network/system $x_{5}$.
rows.n: Also $x_4$ post office, mailbox.  (cf. {benji} [in which the medium need not be a 3rd party service/system, and $x_2$ need not consist of discrete units], {notci}, {xatra}, {tcana})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of rye [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a passport issued to $x_{2}$ (person) by authority $x_{3}$ allowing $x_{4}$ (activity).
$x_{1}$ is captain/commander/leader/in-charge/boss of vehicle/domain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is friction [force opposing motion] due to contact/rubbing between $x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$; (fe) $x_{2}$ rubs $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also $x_2$ scrubs/wipes/brushes (against) $x_3$ (= {seltermosra}); non-agentive rub (= {termosra}).  See also {sakli}, {sraku}, {jabre}, {satre}, {guska}, {pencu}, {spali}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is dead/has ceased to be alive.
$x_{1}$ is/reflects/represents a pattern of forms/events $x_{2}$ arranged according to structure $x_{3}$.
rows.n: [$x_3$ is a model for $x_1$ (= {termontai}, or the more abstract = {termonsi'o}); image (= {gusmo'a}, {nenmo'a}, {dairmo'a}, {selylenmo'a}, {selmirmo'a}, {velmirmo'a}, but also all of these -tai instead of -mo'a for the ideal)]; See also {ciste}, {ganzu}, {marji}, {slilu}, {stura}, {tarmi}, {boxna}, {cimde}, {gidva}, {jimpe}, {rilti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a rule prescribing/mandating/requiring $x_{2}$ (event/state) within system/community $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Regulation, prescription (also $x_2$), principle, requirement (also $x_2$), prescribe, require (conditions are usually contained within $x_2$); $x_1$ is regulatory; $x_2$, $x_3$ are regulated.  See also {flalu}, {ritli}, cmavo list {ja'i}, {marde}, {tcaci}, {tinbe}, {zekri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Moroccan culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ remembers/recalls/recollects fact(s)/memory $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bomb/explosive device with explosive material/principle $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ mole(s) [metric unit] in substance (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mill/foundry/industrial plant/[assembly line] performing process $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (unlike fanri,) need not produce a product; grain mill (= {grumlo}), grinding mill (= {zalmlo}, {zalmlotci}, {zalmloca'a}).  See also {gasta}, {gurni}, {tirse}, {fanri}, {zalvi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the mouth/oral cavity [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (metaphor: entrance/intake for consumption).
$x_{1}$ is a point/instant/moment [0-dimensional shape/form] in/on/at time/place $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is born to $x_{2}$ at time $x_{3}$ [birthday] and place $x_{4}$ [birthplace]; $x_{1}$ is native to (fo) $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ bears/gives birth to $x_1$; also $x_3$: natal day.  See also {fange}, {gutra}, {rorci}, {mamta}, {salci}, {citsi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes $x_{2}$ (object) from source $x_{3}$ for interval $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}).  See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is between/among set of points/bounds/limits $x_{2}$ (set)/amidst mass $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
rows.n: $x_2$ (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for $x_1$.  See also se {vasru}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {snuji}, {senta}, {bitmu}, {jimte}, {kuspe}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {sruri}, {vanbi}, {midju}, {cmima}, {setca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is firm/hard/resistant/unyielding to force $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) decides/makes decision $x_{2}$ (du'u) about matter $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a satellite/moon orbiting $x_{2}$ with characteristics $x_{3}$, orbital parameters $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mold/fungus/mushrooms/truffles of species/strain $x_{2}$ parasitic/growing on $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is less than $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni) by amount $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also negative (= {nonme'a}).  See also cmavo list {me'a}, cmavo list {su'o}, {jdika}, {zmadu}, {traji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a cat/[puss/pussy/kitten] [feline animal] of species/breed $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is feline.
$x_{1}$ is to the side of/lateral to $x_{2}$ and facing $x_{3}$ from point of view/in-frame-of-reference $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (cf. {crane}, {trixe}, {pritu}, {zunle} which differ in that the direction of facing is the front and not the lateral side.  The $x_4$ of mlana may be either the front, or back side of $x_2$, {korbi})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (mass) is a mixture/blend/colloid/commingling with ingredients including $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ mingles/mixes/blends into $x_1$; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component/element of $x_1$ (= {selxre} for reordered places).  See also {salta}, te {runta}, {stasu}, {jicla}, {sanso}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [amount] is the price of $x_{2}$ to purchaser/consumer $x_{3}$ set by vendor $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as "value" or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace).  See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ meter(s) [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Egyptian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/object/event) is famous/renowned/is a celebrity among community of persons $x_{2}$ (mass).
rows.n: Also celebrated/well-known; (derogative meanings:) notorious/infamous (= {malmi'o}; these could also be expressed using the referenced words).  See also se {sinma}, {banli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a deer/elk/moose/[hart/stag/doe] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ keeps $x_{2}$ secret/hidden from $x_{3}$ by method $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ is a secret; $x_{1}$ hides/conceals $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Intransitive hidden/secret, without an agent (= {selcri} or {nalterju'o}); secret (= {selmipri}).  See also {stace}, {mifra}, {sivni}, {djuno}, {cirko}, {jarco}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is money/currency issued by $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.
rows.n: 'currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}).  See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is the same/identical thing as $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; ($x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ interchangeable).
rows.n: (cf. {panra}, {satci}, {mapti}, {simsa}, {drata}, {dunli}, cmavo list {du} - which has no standard place, {simxu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects/mirrors/echoes $x_{2}$ [object/radiation] to observer/point $x_{3}$ as $x_{4}$; $x_{2}$ bounces on $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a mirror/reflector.  $x_2$ may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; $x_4$ may be image or echo or the same as $x_2$ if physical object; $x_3$ may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection.  See also {catlu}, {viska}, {lenjo}, {pensi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) long local distance unit(s) [non-metric], $x_{3}$ subunits, standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {kilto}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a machine for use/function $x_{2}$; [automated apparatus, without direct function control].
rows.n: Also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= {zukte}).  See also {cabra}, {matra}, {tutci}, {zukte}, {pilno}, {skami}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ issues commands/orders to $x_{2}$ for result $x_{3}$ (event/state) to happen; $x_{3}$ is commanded to occur.
rows.n: [also: $x_1$ orders/sets/Triggers. $x_2$ to do/bring about $x_3$; $x_1$ is a commander; commanded (= {termi'e})]; See also {lacri}, te {bende}, {jatna}, {ralju}, {jitro}, {turni}, {tinbe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is mild/non-extreme/gentle/middling/somewhat in property $x_{2}$ (ka); $x_{1}$ is not very $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a thousandth [1/1000; $10^{-3}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a millionth [$10^{-6}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ doctors/treats/nurses/[cures]/is physician/midwife to $x_{2}$ for ailment $x_{3}$ by treatment/cure $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also medic; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_4$ is medical; $x_2$ is a patient of $x_1$ (= selmikce for reordered places) ; $x_2$ is treated by $x_1$ person/$x_4$ treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= {sadmikce}, {sadvelmikce}), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the $x_1$ and $x_4$ of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= {velmikce}).  See also {bilma}, {kanro}, {spita}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is encoded/cipher text of plain-text $x_{2}$ by code/coding system $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is in code; $x_{3}$ is a code.
$x_{1}$ is a polity/state governing territory/domain $x_{2}$; [government/territory relationship].
$x_{1}$ is in/at the middle/center/midpoint/[is a focus] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is central.
$x_{1}$ is a bank owned by/in banking system $x_{2}$ for banking function(s) $x_{3}$ (event).
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ weeks in duration (default is 1 week) by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Re. $x_3$, a week may be more or less than seven days, classically being tied to the time between trips to the marketplace; this week (= {cabjeftu}); next week (= {bavlamjeftu}); last week (= {prulamjeftu}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {masti}, {nanca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Mexican culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to the common Judeo-Christian-Moslem (Abrahamic) culture/religion/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ burns/[ignites/is flammable/inflammable] at temperature $x_{2}$ in atmosphere $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Default $x_2$/$x_3$ to normal temperatures in air; ignite (= {jelcfa}), flammable/inflammable (usually = {jelka'e} or {jelfrili}).  See also {fagri}, {kijno}, {sigja}, {livla}, {sacki}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a gem/polished stone/pearl of type $x_{2}$ from gemstone/material/source $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also jewel (= {jmeja'i}); gemstone (= $x_2$, $x_3$, or {jmero'i}, {jmekunra}); pearl (= {selcakyjme} - a gem found inside a shell, {tercakyjme} - a gem made of shell material, {boijme} - any ball-shaped gem), mother-of-pearl (= {cakyjme}).  See also {kunra}, {rokci}, {jadni}, {dirba}, {kargu}, {krili}, {pulji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) measures/evaluates $x_{2}$ [quantity] as $x_{3}$ units on scale $x_{4}$ (si'o), with accuracy $x_{5}$.
$x_{1}$ pertains to USA/American culture/nationality/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event) shocks/stuns $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ minutes in duration (default is 1 minute) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sister of/sororal to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie/standard/parent(s) $x_{3}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ grows/expands [an increasing development] to size/into form $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also rising, developing; $x_1$ gets bigger/enlarges/increases.  See also {farvi}, {zenba}, {jmina}, {barda}, {makcu}, {ferti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is an axle/spindle [tool] on which $x_{2}$ rotates, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mind/intellect/psyche/mentality/[consciousness] of body $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is mental/psychological/a mental phenomenon; multiple personalities (= so'i {menli}).  See also {besna}, {morji}, {mucti}, {pensi}, {sanji}, {xanri}, {sevzi}, {xadni}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (mass) is an army serving group/community $x_{2}$ (mass) in function $x_{3}$ (activity).
$x_{1}$ reflects Malaysian/Malay culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is beautiful/pleasant to $x_{2}$ in aspect $x_{3}$ (ka) by aesthetic standard $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also handsome, pretty, gorgeous, cute, comely, graceful.  See also {pluka}, {xamgu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [quantifier/expression] is a mathematical expression interpreted under rules/convention $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent/person) earns/[deserves/merits] wages/salary/pay $x_{2}$ for work/service $x_{3}$ (activity).
rows.n: Also $x_2$ earnings, reward (= {zanseljerna} or {nemjerna}), punishment/comeuppance (= {sfaseljerna}, {malseljerna}); $x_3$ behavior; job (= {terjerna}); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyjerna}, {posyseljerna} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {jibri}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {canja}, {jdima}, {jinga}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {janta}, {kargu}, {vamji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ chases/pursues/(physically) follows after $x_{2}$; volition is not implied for $x_{1}$ or $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a million [$10^6$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ reflects Algerian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a needle [pointed shape/form, not tool] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the brow/forehead [projecting flat/smooth head/body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a jet [expelled stream] of material $x_{2}$ expelled from $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is true/truth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {stace}, {jitfa}, {fatci}, {birti}, {cfika}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of wheat [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of oats [grain] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the claw/nail/talon [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed, penetrating, physical weapon].
$x_{1}$ is an angle [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex $x_{2}$ subtended by lateral [segment] $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is angular; $x_2$ corner; (segment $x_3$ can be defined by interval).  See also {kojna}, {linji}, {konju}, {mokca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a motor/engine, driving/propelling/providing power to $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains butter/oleo/margarine/shortening from source $x_{2}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is buttery; an edible fat, solid but spreadable at normal temperatures; dairy butter (= {ladmatne}).  See also {grasu}, {kruji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of linen/flax [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ is a mat/pad/mattress/pallet [flat, soft, dense form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ grasps/holds/clutches/seizes/grips/[hugs] $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ (part of $x_{1}$) at locus $x_{4}$ (part of $x_{2}$).
rows.n: Hug (= {birjai}, {pamjai}); handshake (= {xanjaisi'u}); hold with hands (= {xanjai}); handle (= {jaitci}).  See also {ralte}, {pencu}, {darxi}, {batke}, {rinju}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ months in duration (default is 1 month) by month standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: This month (= {cabma'i}); next month (= {bavla'ima'i}); last month (= {prula'ima'i}).  See also {detri}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {nanca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ [force] mashes/crushes/squashes/smashes $x_{2}$ into pulp/mash/crumbs/deformed mass $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is material/stuff/matter of type/composition including $x_{2}$ in shape/form $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is physical (one sense)/material.  See also {morna}, {mucti}, {nejni}, {tarmi}, {dacti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/made of mercury/quicksilver; [metaphor: fluid metal; temperature].
$x_{1}$ are the ethics/morals/moral standards/ethical standards of $x_{2}$ (ind./mass) about situation $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ will (typically) be an abstract, a rule or rules of behavior; also principles; also conscience (= {sezmarde}).  See also {palci}, {vrude}, {lijda}, {manri}, {javni}, {tarti}, {zekri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying $x_{2}$ in/on surface/medium $x_{3}$, propelled by $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelter/haven/refuge/retreat/harbor for/protecting $x_{2}$ from danger/threat $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ fits/matches/suits/is compatible/appropriate/corresponds to/with $x_{2}$ in property/aspect $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a knot/tangle in/between $x_{2}$ (object/jo'u-objects).
rows.n: Knot (verb = {jgegau}, {jgezu'e}, {jgeri'a}, {jgela'a}), knot: fastening between two or more cords (= {jgeterjo'e}).  See also {pluja}, {julne}, {lasna}, {skori}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cotton [type of fabric/material].
$x_{1}$ is a cap/hat/crown/helmet/piece of headgear [head-top garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a gene of creature [or locus on creature] $x_{2}$ determining trait/process $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an ant of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ satisfies evaluator $x_{2}$ in property (ka)/state $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a frame of reference/standard for observing/measuring/determining $x_{2}$, with/by rules $x_{3}$.
rows.n: ($x_1$ may be object or si'o idea); See also cmavo list {ma'i}, {ckilu}, {merli}, {pajni}, {cimde}, {jdice}, {marde}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is dark/lacking in illumination.
$x_{1}$ (person) feels/has pride in/about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
rows.n: An emotional combination of satisfaction and respect/esteem towards property(ies) or action(s) of person/entity that has a specific tie to emoter; self-pride (= {se'ijgi}, {tolcumla}); use $x_2$ tu'a for pride in non-specific actions/properties of someone.  See also {cinmo}, {cumla}, {sevzi}, {sinma}, {snada}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (object/event) is uniform/homogeneous in property $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ feels wonder/awe/marvels about $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mother of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ bears/mothers/acts maternally toward $x_{2}$; [not necessarily biological].
$x_{1}$ is a temple/church/sanctuary/synagogue/shrine of religion $x_{2}$ at location/serving area $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be event of form (... worships/pays/respect to ...), hence (metaphorically extending to) monument (= {mojmalsi}, {si'armalsi}).  See also {cevni}, {krici}, {lijda}, {ritli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is magnetic [adjective] producing magnetic field $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is magic/supernatural/sorcery/witchcraft/wizardry to $x_{2}$, performed by person/force/deity $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is mature/ripe/fully-grown/adult in development-quality $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ is guitar/violin/fiddle/harp [stringed musical instrument] with actuator/plectrum/bow $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also lute, viola, cello.  See also {zgike}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is near/close to/approximates $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni).
$x_{1}$ is a job/occupation/employment/vocation (a type of work regularly done for pay) of person $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Working for another (= {selplijibri}).  See also {briju}, {gunka}, {te} {jerna} which is employment specifically for pay and not specifically for another, {te} {pilno} which is employment not necessarily for pay and not necessarily regular or lasting but for another, {se} {gasnu} and {se} {zukte} for incidental activities.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (object, or event: force) stirs/mixes/[roils/agitates] fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/action/process) is manual [not automatic] in function $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a mammal/'animal'/beast of species $x_{2}$.

$x_1$ is execrable/deplorable/wretched/shitty/awful/rotten/miserable/contemptible/crappy/inferior/low-quality in property $x_2$ by standard $x_3$; $x_1$ stinks/sucks in aspect $x_2$ according to $x_3$.
rows.n: Bloody (British sense), fucking, shit, goddamn. See also {zabna}, {xlali}, {palci}, {dapma}, {funca}, {ganti}, {ganxo}, {gletu}, {gutra}, {kalci}, {pinca}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}, {zargu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a basis/foundation/underlying or fundamental principle of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is at the bottom of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ is founded on basis $x_1$ (= {selcmu} for reordered places); (adjective:) $x_1$ is basic/basal/fundamental); (generally events and properties will be bases for events and states, while objects may be bases/bottoms for objects).  See also cmavo list {ji'u}, {jamfu}, {zbepi}, {genja}, {krasi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (person) intuits $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; [epistemology].
rows.n: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jimpe}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {sidbo}, {smadi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ interacts/behaves socially with $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ socializes with/is sociable towards $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of liquor/spirits distilled from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali/base of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is jealous of/envies $x_{2}$ (person) about/for $x_{3}$ (property - ka).
$x_{1}$ is a branch/bough/limb of $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ forks into branches $x_{1}$; [preferred over metaphorical birka].
$x_{1}$ condenses/liquefies on/into $x_{2}$ at temperature $x_{3}$, pressure $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ is dew/condensate on $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is Earth's moon (default); $x_{1}$ is a major natural satellite/moon of planet $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is bare/naked/nude; $x_{1}$ is without cover/clothes/[protection].
$x_{1}$ (agent) washes/cleanses $x_{2}$ of soil/contaminant $x_{3}$ in/with cleaning material(s) $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ understands/comprehends fact/truth $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ understands (fi) $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a compound predicate word with meaning $x_{2}$ and arguments $x_{3}$ built from metaphor $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a limit/extreme/bound/border/[confinement] of $x_{2}$ in property/domain $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Restrain/constrain within limits (= {jitri'u}, {jitygau}, {jityzu'e}).  See also cmavo list {ji'e}, {traji}, {korbi}, {kuspe}, {rinju}, {bapli}, {curmi}, {fanta}, {jbini}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a pair of shears/scissors for cutting $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Lebanese culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/team) wins/gains prize $x_{2}$ from/over $x_{3}$ [competitors/losers] in competition $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also: $x_1$ is a victor; $x_2$ reward; $x_3$ competitors here are opponents and in many situations, defeated/losers, vs. the set of those competing for a goal; $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyji'a}, {posyselji'a} for unambiguous semantics).   See also {cirko}, {jivna}, {talsa}, {cnemu}, {prali}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {bradi}, {kargu}, {kelci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a vaccine/immune-system stimulant protecting $x_{2}$ against disease $x_{3}$ introduced by method $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of made of metal of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fox [bushy-tailed wild dog/canine] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/person) is immersed/submerged/bathes in liquid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a floor/bottom/ground of $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Floor/level/story of a building/edifice (= {setloi}, {dijysenta}).  See also {bitmu}, {drudi}, {dertu}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {zbepi}, {sarji}, {serti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (object) is clean/pure of material/contaminant/dirt $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a well/spring of fluid $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects [Loglandic]/Lojbanic language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Pre-Lojban forms of Loglan (= {dzejbo}). See also {bangu}, {logji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ thinks/opines $x_{2}$ [opinion] (du'u) is true about subject/issue $x_{3}$ on grounds $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {djuno}, {krici}, {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {senpi}, {sidbo}, {birti}, {pinka}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (property - ka) is an innate/inherent/intrinsic/natural property/quality/aspect of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a chicken/[hen/cock/rooster]/small fowl [a type of bird] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [rules/methods] is a logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $x_{2}$ (du'u).
$x_{1}$ is a tip/point/vertex/extremity/end [0-dimension shape/form] on object $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the horn [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed extremity].
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of juice/nectar from-source/of-type $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Water-based extract from a (generally) biological source. See also {pinxe}, {djacu}, {grute}, {stagi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a fuel/energy-source for powering $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the liver [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is false/is an untruth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place.  See also {fatci}, {stace}, {jetnu}, {cfika}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ travels/journeys/goes/moves via route $x_{2}$ using means/vehicle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a traveller.
rows.n: ($x_2$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly); See also {bajra}, {cadzu}, {cpare}, {tcana}, {klama}, {cliva}, {pluta}, {limna}, {muvdu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is liquid/fluid, of composition/material including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Conditions include temperature and pressure.  See also {cilmo}, {djacu}, {lumci}, {runta}, {pambe}, {sudga}, {gapci}, {sligu}, {flecu}, {jduli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ liter(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (physical object) is a list/catalog/register of sequence/set $x_{2}$ in order $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also roll, log.  ($x_2$ is completely specified); (cf. {porsi}, {girzu}, {cmima} for mental objects wherein order is of varying importance; some manifested order is intrinsic to a physical list, but the specific order may be incidental and not intentional/purposeful)

rows.d: $x_1$ is a story/tale/yarn/narrative about plot/subject/moral $x_2$ by storyteller $x_3$ to audience $x_4$.
rows.n: Also legend; a narrative need not be fictional; $x_2$ may be merely a convention rather than a subject; also $x_3$ tells/recounts story/tale $x_1$ about $x_2$ to $x_4$ (= {selterlisri} for place reordering); note that the storyteller need not be the author.  See also {ranmi}, {cfika}, {skicu}, {prosa}, {pemci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ has control over/harnesses/manages/directs/conducts $x_{2}$ in $x_{3}$ (activity/event/performance).
rows.n: $x_2$ are aspects/individuals controlled within activity/event $x_3$; manage (= {selzuktro}, {selzukfu'e}, {gu'etro}, {gunfu'e}, {xaktro}, {xakfu'e}) (as distinct from manager/boss = {gunterbe'e}, {gunja'a}, {gunmi'e}, {gunca'i}).  (cf. cmavo list {ji'o}, {bapli}, te {bende}, {gidva} - which does not necessarily control or command, {jatna}, {macnu}, {minde}, {ponse}, {ralju}, {rinka}, {sazri}, {turni}, {vlipa}, {xance}, {xlura})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is light in mass/weight by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a length of chain/links of material $x_{2}$ with link properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a line/among lines [1-dimensional shape/form] defined by set of points $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ weaves $x_{2}$ from material/[yarn] $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is lightning/electrical arc/thunderbolt striking at/extending to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ competes/vies with opponent $x_{2}$ in contest/competition $x_{3}$ (event) for gain $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ rivals $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Also $x_2$ opponent(s), competitor(s), rival(s); $x_3$ competition, race; $x_4$ prize, reward, recognition (gain may be internal or external).  See also {cnemu}, {jinga}, {talsa}, {bradi}, {fapro}, {kelci}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) swims in fluid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass/jo'u) gathers/collects at location $x_{2}$ from locations $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ is a shoal [shallow hazard]/reef of material $x_{2}$ in body of water $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a religion of believers including $x_{2}$ sharing common beliefs/practices/tenets including $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also mythos, creed, traditional beliefs, $x_2$ people(s), adherents; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_3$ are religious/ecclesiastic in nature; $x_2$ is a believer in/of $x_1$, an adherent/follower of $x_1$ (= {seljda} for reordered places); $x_2$ is a practitioner of $x_3$ (= {selterjda} for reordered places); $x_3$ is a tenet/belief/ritual/creed of $x_1$/$x_2$ (= {terjda} for reordered places); priest/clerical (= {jdaca'i}, {jdaka'i}, {jdaja'a}); organized church/religion (= {be'ejda}); congregation (= {jdabe'e}, {jdagri}).  See also {budjo}, {censa}, {cevni}, {crida}, {dadjo}, {jegvo}, {krici}, {latna}, {malsi}, {marde}, {muslo}, {pruxi}, {ranmi}, {ritli}, {xriso}, {zekri}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ adds/combines $x_{2}$ to/with $x_{3}$, with result $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ augments $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ lives/is alive by standard $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an organism/living thing.
$x_{1}$ [person/passive/state] undergoes/experiences $x_{2}$ (event/experience); $x_{2}$ happens to $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Also has/have (of events/experiences); (adjective:) $x_1$ is empirical; suggests passive undergoing but does not exclude active (per zukte) intent; a deserved experience: reward or punishment (= {jernyfri}, {zanjernyfri}, {maljernyfri}).  See also cmavo list {ri'i}, {jmive}, {fasnu}, {renvi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Jordanian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ precedes/leads $x_{2}$ in sequence $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is former/preceding/previous; $x_{2}$ is latter/following.
rows.n: Also $x_1$ before, forerunner; leading, as in 'leading indicators'; $x_2$ after, trailing (= {selyli'e} for reordered places).  See also cmavo list {li'e}, {balvi}, {ralju}, {rebla}, {purci} for time sequence, {jersi}, {porsi}, {jatna}, {farna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Libyan culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is joined to/connects to/is united with $x_{2}$ at common locus $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ are a union.
rows.n: Also joined/fastened/attached by joint $x_3$/by means of $x_3$/with fastener $x_3$; fastener (= {jo'etci}, {jonvelyla'a}); train, sequence of joined objects (= {jonpoi}; {porjo'e} for a single object joined into a sequence).  See also {lasna}, {fenso}, {kansa}, {pencu}, {penmi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a table/flat solid upper surface of material $x_{2}$, supported by legs/base/pedestal $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an address of/are coordinates of $x_{2}$ in system $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a sentence/statement about $x_{2}$ [topic/subject/predicate/focus] in language $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_{2}$ representing $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also $x_1$ glyph, rune, character (also me'o BY/word-bu), $x_2$ symbol set; (adjective:) $x_1$ is alphabetic/symbolic; "letteral" used by analogy with "numeral"; sinxa is the more generic symbol.  See also {mifra}, {namcu}, {sinxa}, {pandi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) is late by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a spider/arachnid/crustacean/crab/lobster/non-insect arthropod of species/breed $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Due to the unusual grouping of concepts in this definition, {ankabuta} is favored for "spider". See also {cinki}, {danlu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is cold/cool by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lens/glass [focussing shape/form] focussing $x_{2}$ to focus/foci $x_{3}$ by means/material $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is optical; focussing may be optical or otherwise, hence $x_2$ which may be light, sound, X-ray, etc., default is light/optical lens; ka is refraction. See also {kacma}, {minra}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_{2}$ by recipe/method $x_{3}$ (process).
rows.n: Cook with heat (= {glajukpa}, {glaterjukpa}), bake (= {tokyjukpa}); fry (= {rasyjukpa}).  See also {cupra}, {bredi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a net/filter allowing passage of $x_{2}$, prohibiting passage of $x_{3}$, netting properties $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is attentive towards/attends/tends/pays attention to object/affair $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Chinese [Mandarin, Cantonese, Wu, etc.] culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is clock/watch/timer measuring time units $x_{2}$ to precision $x_{3}$ with timing mechanism/method $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ takes/gets/gains/obtains/seizes/[removes] $x_{2}$ (object/property) from $x_{3}$ (possessor).
rows.n: Also confiscate, appropriate.  Acquire with volition such that $x_1$ gains possession; $x_3$ is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied.  (cf. {punji}, {cpacu} where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, {vimcu} for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, {canci}, {cliva})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (person) is serious/earnest/has gravity about $x_{2}$ (event/state/activity).
$x_{1}$ is the weight of object $x_{2}$ in [gravitational or other force] field $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is lazy/avoiding work/effort concerning action $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bacterium/germ/microbe/protozoan/amoeba [1-celled life] of species/defining property $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/action/state) is severe/harsh to $x_{2}$ [victim/experiencer].
$x_{1}$ is a species of genus $x_{2}$, family $x_{3}$, etc.; [open-ended tree-structure categorization].
rows.n: Also subspecies, order, phylum; (places do not correspond to specific levels in the hierarchy; rather, $x_1$ is at a "lower" or "bushier" part of the tree than $x_2$, $x_2$ is "lower" than $x_3$, etc.; skipping a place thus means that there is one or more known-and-unspecified levels of hierarchy between the two); not limited to Linnean animal/plant taxonomy.  See also {klesi}, {lanzu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a lotus, plant/flower/herb of species/strain $x_{2}$ symbolizing $x_{3}$ to culture/religion $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Latin/Roman/Romance culture/empire/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of brass [copper/zinc alloy] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ with fastener $x_{4}$.
rows.n: No implication that result is considered a single object; although $x_2$ and $x_3$ may be reversible, $x_3$ may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which $x_2$ becomes attached. See also {jorne}, {fenso}, {jgena}, {batke}, {dinko}, {kansa}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (action) is clumsy/awkward by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (process) is an art [creative application] of craft/skill $x_{2}$ (idea/activity).
$x_{1}$ is the view/scene/panorama/sight/prospect of $x_{2}$ (object/location) from point-of-view $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also $x_1$ is on display to $x_2$/$x_3$.  See also {catlu}, {kanla}, {viska}, {canko}, {jarco}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (mass) is a family with members including $x_{2}$ bonded/tied/joined according to standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also clan, tribe; $x_2$ is in $x_1$, a member of $x_1$ ({selylanzu} for reordered places); relative (= {lazmi'u} - xy mintu y'y leka cmima da poi lanzu).  See also {natmi}, {cmima}, {girzu}, {jutsi}, {klesi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is in balance/equilibrium under forces $x_{2}$ (mass).
$x_{1}$ is a can/tightly sealed/pre-sealed container for perishable contents $x_{2}$, made of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cup/glass/tumbler/mug/vessel/[bowl] containing contents $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: A kabri is normally eaten from by lifting it; a palta is not.  See also {palta}, {citka}, {blaci}, {tansi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram] of species/breed $x_{2}$ of flock $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ analyzes/examines-in-detail $x_{2}$ by method/technique/system $x_{3}$ [process/activity].
$x_{1}$ is a basket with contents $x_{2}$, woven from material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a camera/photographic equipment recording illumination type $x_{2}$ images to medium $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a flag/banner/standard of/symbolizing $x_{2}$ with pattern(s) $x_{3}$ on material $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of protein/albumin of type $x_{2}$ composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u) $x_{3}$ .
$x_{1}$ is adjacent/beside/next to/in contact with $x_{2}$ in property/sequence $x_{3}$ in direction $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also touching, contiguous, against.  See also {zvati}, {cpana}, {jibni}, {diklo}, {stuzi}, {bartu}, {jbini}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a lake/lagoon/pool at site/within land mass $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Canadian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is quantity of wax [substance especially soft/moldable when warm] from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state/property) is probable/likely under conditions $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ coughs/farts/burps up/out $x_{2}$ [predominantly gaseous] from orifice $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a company/corporation/firm/partnership chartered by authority $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (force) lifts/applies raising/supporting force to $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$ in gravity well $x_{4}$.
rows.n: ($x_1$ may be an abstract); verb lift/raise/elevate (= {lafmuvgau}). See also {farlu}, {plipe}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event/experience) warns/cautions $x_{2}$ (person) of/about danger $x_{3}$ (event/state/property).
rows.n: Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}).  See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of milk from source $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is lactic/dairy.
$x_{1}$ relies/depends/counts on/trusts $x_{2}$ to bring about/ensure/maintain $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ pulls/tugs/draws/drags $x_{2}$ by handle/at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object $x_{2}$, for purpose $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is able to do/be/capable of doing/being $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$ (event/state).
rows.n: Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}).  (cf. {stati}, {certu}, {gasnu} (in the time-free potential sense), {cmavo} list {ka'e}, cmavo list {nu'o}, cmavo list {pu'i}, {djuno}, {zifre})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a wolf/lupine of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) digs $x_{2}$ [material] up/out of $x_{3}$ [source/hole] with limbs/tool(s) $x_{4}$.
rows.n: Also $x_1$ cuts into $x_3$ (with material removal).  See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the feces/excrement/dung/shit of $x_{2}$ (animal/person); (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is fecal (matter).
$x_{1}$ (portal/passage/entrance-way) is open/ajar/not shut permitting passage/access to $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
rows.n: As a doorway. $x_{3}$ is given access to $x_{2}$ through portal $x_{1}$. See also {ganlo}, {pagre}, {canko}, {vorme}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is chaotic/disordered in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka).
$x_{1}$ (person) is cruel/mean/unkind to victim $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ ranges/extends/spans/persists/reaches across/over interval/gap/area/scope/extent/range $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ hunts/stalks prey/quarry/game $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}).  See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is bitter/acrid/sharply disagreeable to observer/sense $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ takes-care-of/looks after/attends to/provides for/is caretaker for $x_{2}$ (object/event/person).
rows.n: Also tends, cares for, keeps; $x_1$ is a keeper/custodian of $x_2$.  See also {jundi}, {cinri}, {prami}, {raktu}, {zgana}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a right-angled shape/form defined by set of vertices $x_{2}$, dimensions $x_{3}$ (default 2).
rows.n: Also rectangle, square, rectilinear; square (= {kubykurfa}, {pitkubykurfa}), cube (= {kurkubli}), rectangle (= {clakurfa}), rhombus/diamond (= {sa'orkurfa}, {sa'orpitkubli}).  See also {bliku}, {kubli}, {tapla}, {salpo}, {tarmi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a column/pillar of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [container] is empty/vacant of $x_{2}$ [material]; $x_{1}$ is hollow.
rows.n: Also vacuum (= kunti be roda/so'ada).  See also {culno}, {tisna}, {claxu}, {canlu}, {kevna}, {setca}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is/contains/is made from a mineral/ore of type/metal $x_{2}$ mined from location/lode/mine $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a camel/llama/alpaca/vicuna/dromedary of species/breed $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Llama (= {tcokumte}), Bactrian camel (= {zdokumte}); Arabian camel/dromedary (= {rabykumte}).  See also {sunla}, {kanla}, {xirma}, {xasli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a room of/in structure $x_{2}$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_{1}$ [mass of ideas, customs, skills, arts] is culture of nation/ethos $x_{2}$ (mass); $x_{1}$ is ethnic.
rows.n: (note that $x_2$ is NOT individual; culture is what is shared among people and is not an individual trait).  See also cmavo list {ka'u}, cmavo list {ku'u}, {natmi}, {cecmu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is delicious/tasty/delightful to observer/sense $x_{2}$ [person, or sensory activity].
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is common/general/universal among members of set $x_{2}$ (complete set).
rows.n: Only fully universal sense applies; $x_1$ must be found in all members of $x_2$.  For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}.  See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ feels comfort/is comfortable with conditions/environmental property(ies) $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a goat/angora/[billy-goat/kid] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is curious/wonders about/is interested in/[inquisitive about] $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
$x_{1}$ is a cube/regular polyhedron/polygon of dimensions $x_{2}$ (def. 3), surfaces/sides $x_{3}$ (def. 6).
rows.n: (cf. {kurfa} - needed for 'cube', {bliku} for a physical object; {tanbo}, {tapla}, {tarmi})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (agent) counts the number in set $x_{2}$ to be $x_{3}$ [number/count] counting [off] by units $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
rows.n: In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness).  See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a curve/turn/bend in $x_{2}$, at locus $x_{3}$, and defined by set of points/properties $x_{4}$.
rows.n: (adjective:) $x_1$ is curved; ($x_4$ as a set of points is sufficiently specified to identify the relevant properties of the bend).  See also {korcu}, {bargu}, {genxu}, {linji}, {sirji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of cream/emulsion/puree [consistency] of composition $x_{2}$.
rows.n: [$x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification]]; See also {ladru}, {matne}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ intersects/crosses/traverses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ calculates/reckons/computes $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ cries out/yells/howls sound $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a crier.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).
rows.n: See also {ciksi}, {rinka}, {nibli}, {mukti}, se {jalge}, te {zukte}, cmavo list {ki'u}, {bapli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of crystal of composition $x_{2}$ in form/arrangement $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification.  See also {jemna}, {bisli}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ believes [regardless of evidence/proof] belief/creed $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true/assumed about subject $x_{3}$.
rows.n: "without evidence" refers to objective external evidence; also gives credence, has conviction.  See also {jinvi}, {djuno}, {censa}, {cevni}, {lijda}, {makfa}, {malsi}, {senpi}, {birti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (event) is the $x_{3}$'rd recurrence/repetition of $x_{2}$ (abstract); $x_{2}$ happens again in [form] $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Also case, another, instance, different, other, time, occasion.  See also {fukpi}, {rapli}, {cafne}, {fasnu}, {xruti}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ represents/is an agent/proxy/stands-in for [absent] $x_{2}$ in matter(s)/function(s) $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also: on behalf of.  See also cmavo list {ka'i}, {jansu}, {catni}, {vipsi}, {pulji}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).
rows.n: Also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) $x_1$ is initial.  See also {fanmo}, cmavo list {ra'i}, {sabji}, {cfari}, {jipno}, {traji}, {kojna}, {genja}, {jicmu}, {sitna}, {jinto}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ local area unit(s) [non-metric] (default 1) by standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
rows.n: (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
$x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a coat/jacket/sweater/cloak/[cape/shawl/pullover] [extra outer garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).
rows.n: $x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantum/ray/elementary particle/smallest measurable increment of property/activity $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Quantum ray (= {bonka'u}).  (cf. {selci} for masses and most objects; {ratni}, {gradu}, {gusni}, {nejni}, {linji})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cork/bark from tree/species $x_{2}$; [material].
(adjective:) $x_{1}$ is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded.
$x_{1}$ is an edge/margin/border/curb/boundary of $x_{2}$ next-to/bordering-on $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a conjunction, stating that $x_{2}$ (du'u) and $x_{3}$ (du'u) are both true.
$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a cone [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$ with vertex $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a comb [many-needled shape] of material $x_{2}$ with tines/needles $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bitumen from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$
$x_{1}$ is a corner/point/at-least-3-dimensional [solid] angle [shape/form] in/on $x_{2}$, of material $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also apex; a corner exists on three dimensions but need not be limited to points; it suggests a discontinuity in slope in some direction; i.e. in some planar cross-section.  See also {jipno}, {konju}, {bliku}, {fanmo}, {jganu}, {krasi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
rows.n: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {poskargu} for unambiguous semantics).  See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a collar/ring/belt/band around/surrounding $x_{2}$ made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of cabbage/lettuce/leafy vegetable of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a journal/periodical/magazine/[newspaper] with content $x_{2}$ published by $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$.
rows.n: $x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list.  See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.
rows.n: For $x_1$ force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= {ka'argau}, {ka'arzu'e}).  (cf. {kakpa}, {sraku} for cutting into without division; {plixa}, {dakfu}, {jinci}, {porpi}, {spofu}, {tunta}, {xrani}, {fatri}, {fendi}, {balre}, {dilcu})

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (obj.) is loose/bloused/not tight on $x_{2}$ (obj.) at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a screw [fastener] for purpose $x_{2}$, threads [pitch, material] $x_{3}$, frame [size, material] $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}).  See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of halogen of type $x_{2}$ [chlorine, fluorine, iodine, etc.].
rows.n: Also bromine; default chlorine. See also {xukmi}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear $x_{2}$ [transmission].
rows.n: Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}).  (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')

rows.d: $x_{1}$ (person) pities/feels sorry for $x_{2}$ (person) about $x_{3}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ (mass/si'o) is a class/category/subgroup/subset within $x_{2}$ with defining property $x_{3}$ (ka).
rows.n: Also taxon, type, kind, classification, species, genus, family, order, phylum.  See also cmavo list {le'a}, {cmima}, {jutsi}, {ciste}, {girzu}, {lanzu}, {vrici}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ is a quantity quantified/measured/enumerated by $x_{2}$ (quantifier) on scale $x_{3}$ (si'o).
rows.n: Also count.  See also cmavo list {la'u}, {namcu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ comes/goes to destination $x_{2}$ from origin $x_{3}$ via route $x_{4}$ using means/vehicle $x_{5}$.
rows.n: Also travels, journeys, moves, leaves to ... from ...; $x_1$ is a traveller; ($x_4$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly).  See also {cadzu}, {bajra}, {marce}, {vofli}, {litru}, {muvdu}, {cpare}, cmavo list {ka'a}, {pluta}, {bevri}, {farlu}, {limna}, {vitke}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ weeps/cries tears $x_{2}$ about/for reason $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is a street/avenue/lane/drive/cul-de-sac/way/alley/[road] at $x_{2}$ accessing $x_{3}$.
rows.n: Also corridor; not typically a route between points, but offers access to sites along it.  See also {naxle}, {panka}, {pluta}, {dargu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ [agent] plays with plaything/toy $x_{2}$.
rows.n: Play game (= {ci'erkei}), play competitively (= {jvikei}).  See also {jivna}, {jinga}, {zdile}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ reflects Pakistani/Pashto culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cancer [malignant disease] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is outer space near/associated with celestial body/region $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is sharp/keen at locus $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hair/fur [body-part] of $x_{2}$ at body location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the ear [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus, information gathering].
$x_{1}$ is a thousand [1000; $10^3$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of oxygen (O); [metaphor: supporting life/combustion].
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
rows.n: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}).  See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

rows.d: $x_{1}$ cushions $x_{2}$ with material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a cushion/pillow/pad [for $x_{2}$] of padding material $x_{3}$.
digit/number: enough; subjective.
logical connective: sumti afterthought or.
vocative: thanks - no thanks to you.
discursive: repeating - continuing.
ckini modal, 1st place (related to)               relatively; as a relation of ...
vocative: please repeat.
digit/number: number comma; thousands.
krinu modal, 1st place (justified by)             justifiably; because of reason ...
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
discursive: marks word serving as focus of indirect question: "I know WHO went to the store".
pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #1 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #2 (specified by goi).
korbi modal, 1st place (bordered by)              bounded by ...
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #3 (specified by goi).
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
rows.n: Acts as a number punctuation mark (separating the real and the imaginary parts of a complex number); for example "ci ka'o re" means 3 + 2i. See also: {kau'o}, {ka'o'ai}, {ka'o'ei}.

rows.d: pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #4 (specified by goi).
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #5 (specified by goi).
elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.
non-logical connective: intersection of sets.
elidable terminator: end mathematical (mex) forethought (Polish) expression; often elidable.
discursive: however/but/in contrast.
elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause; always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.
kulnu modal, 1st place                            in culture ...
letteral for k.
name descriptor: the one(s) called ... ; takes name or selbri description.
discursive: probability - improbability.
the referent of (indirect pointer); uses the referent of a sumti as the desired sumti.
krati modal, 1st place                            represented by ...
ckaji modal, 1st place                            characterizing ...
name descriptor: the mass of individual(s) named ... ; takes name or selbri description.
name descriptor: the set of those named ... ; takes name or selbri description.
modal aspect: innate capability; possibly unrealized.
klama modal, 1st place                            gone to by ...
abstractor: property/quality abstractor (-ness); $x_{1}$ is quality/property exhibited by [bridi].
letteral for j.
delimited non-Lojban name; the resulting quote sumti is treated as a name.
binary mathematical operator: number base; [a interpreted in the base b].
2-word letteral/shift: punctuation mark or special symbol follows.
klani modal, 1st place (amount)                   quantifying ...; being a quantity of ...
attitudinal modifier: certainty - uncertainty - impossibility.
non-veridical descriptor: the one(s) described as ...
klesi modal, 1st place (scalar set)               in/of category ...
non-veridical descriptor: the stereotype of those described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
attitudinal modifier: aggressive - passive - defensive.
vocative: attention - at ease - ignore me.
vague non-logical connective: analogous to plain ".i".
end quote of questionable or out-of-context text; not elidable.
the number/evaluated expression; convert number/operand/evaluated math expression to sumti.
evidential: I state - (default) elliptical/non-specific basis.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought whether-or-not.
non-logical connective: in common with; along with (unmixed).
discursive: clearly - obscurely.
lidne modal, 1st place                            preceded by ...; non-time sequencing.
shift letterals to Arabic alphabet.
join mathematical expression (mex) operands into an array.
non-logical connective: mixed conjunction; "and" meaning "mixed together", forming a mass.
non-logical connective: union of sets.
discursive: metalinguistic affirmer.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if.
abstractor: experience abstractor; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s experience of [bridi] (participant or observer).
jicmu modal, 1st place (assumptions);             given that ...; based on ...
discursive: omitted text (quoted material).
elidable terminator: end grammatical quotation; seldom elidable except at end of text.
descriptor: the one, which (is / does) ... / those, which (are / do) ...
rows.n: Terminated with {ku}. Under the xorlo reform, {lo} converts a selbri to a sumti in a generic way. In particular, lo broda = {zo'e} noi broda.

rows.d: shift letterals to Lojban (Roman) alphabet.
veridical descriptor: the typical one(s) who really is(are) ...
jitro modal, 1st place (control)                  controlledly; under direction of ...
veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) that is(are) ...
veridical descriptor: the set of those that really are ..., treated as a set.
elidable terminator: end math express.(mex) sumti; end mex-to-sumti conversion; usually elidable.
start questionable/out-of-context quote; text should be Lojban words, but needn't be grammatical.
start grammatical quotation; quoted text should be grammatical on its own.
the members of the set/components of the mass; converts another description type to individuals.
the symbol for (indirect discourse); uses the symbol/word(s) for a sumti as the desired sumti.
the set with members; converts another description type to a set of the members.
the mass composed of; converts another description type to a mass composed of the members.
elidable terminator: end of sumti qualifiers; usually elidable except before a sumti.
letteral for l.
pro-sumti: sumti question (what/who/how/why/etc.); appropriately fill in sumti blank.
digit/number: approximately (default the typical value in this context) (number).
jimte modal, 1st place                            limitedly; up to limit ...
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s) & others unspecified.
marji modal, 1st place                            material in object/substance ...
utterance ordinal suffix; converts a number to an ordinal, such as an item or paragraph number.
manri modal, 1st place (by standard 2)            in reference frame ...
discursive: additionally.
logical connective: sumti afterthought connective question.
convert letteral string or other mathematical expression (mex) operand to mex operator.
zmadu modal, 1st place (a greater)                exceeded by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
digit/number: plus sign; positive number; default any positive.
discursive: truth - falsity.
convert sumti to selbri/tanru element; $x_{1}$ is specific to [sumti] in aspect $x_{2}$.
mleca modal, 1st place (a lesser)                 undercut by ... ; usually a sumti modifier.
cmene modal, 1st place (requires quote)           with name ...; so-called ...
convert number to cardinality selbri; $x_{1}$ is a mass formed from a set $x_{2}$ of n members, one or more of which is/are $x_{3}$, measured relative to the set $x_{4}$.
rows.n: [$x_1$ is a mass with N components $x_3$ composing set $x_2$; $x_2$ is an n-tuple ($x_2$ is completely specified) (= {selmei} for reordered places); $x_1$ forms an n-some; $x_3$ (not necessarily a complete enumeration) are among the members of $x_2$); See also {cmima}, {gunma}, cmavo list {moi}.

rows.d: digit/number: less than.
shift letterals to Hebrew alphabet.
the mathematical expression (unevaluated); convert unevaluated mathematical expression to sumti.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought conn question.
abstractor: truth-value abstractor; $x_{1}$ is truth value of [bridi] under epistemology $x_{2}$.
elidable terminator: end sumti that was converted to selbri; usually elidable.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s); identified by self-vocative.
vocative: roger (ack) - negative acknowledge; used to acknowledge offers and thanks.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & others unspecified, but not you, the listener.
self vocative: self-introduction - denial of identity; identifies speaker.
scalar affirmer; denies scalar negation: Indeed!.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought and.
non-logical interval connective: ordered components: ... center, ... range surrounding center.
pro-sumti: me/we the speaker(s)/author(s) & you the listener(s).
discursive: ditto.
pro-bridi: bridi/selbri/brivla question.
digit/number: too few; subjective.
convert sumti to mex operand; sample use in story arithmetic: [3 apples] + [3 apples] = what.
convert number to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is (n)th member of set $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
mark motions in space-time.
higher-order utterance ordinal suffix; converts a number to ordinal, usually a section/chapter.
digit/number: hex digit D (decimal 13) [thirteen].
interval event contour: at the natural ending point of ...; completive              |    >|<.
digit/number: 5 (digit) [five].
discursive: for example - omitting - end examples.
abstractor: achievement (event) abstractor; $x_{1}$ is the event-as-a-point/achievement of [bridi].
evidential: I conclude.
mukti modal, 1st place                            because of motive ...
vocative: over (response OK) - more to come.
mupli modal, 1st place                            exemplified by ...
letteral for m.
bridi contradictory negator; scope is an entire bridi; logically negates in some cmavo compounds.
cancel all letteral shifts.
contrary scalar negator: other than ...; not ...; a scale or set is implied.
attached to cmavo to negate them; various negation-related meanings.
discursive: metalinguistic negator.
javni modal, 1st place (by standard 1)            orderly; by rule ...
convert tense/modal (tagged) place to 1st place; 1st place moves to extra FA place (fai).
jalge modal, 1st place                            resultingly; therefore result ...
tense interval modifier: characteristically/typically; tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
tense: refers to current space/time reference absolutely.
bridi logical affirmer; scope is an entire bridi.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought or.
attitudinal: familiarity - mystery.
attitudinal: love - no love lost - hatred.
attitudinal: appreciation - envy.
attitudinal: respect - disrespect.
attitudinal: togetherness - privacy.
attitudinal: fear - security.
attitudinal: approval - non-approval - disapproval.
attitudinal: agreement - disagreement.
attitudinal: acceptance - blame.
attitudinal: belief - skepticism - disbelief.
sentence link/continuation; continuing sentences on same topic; normally elided for new speakers.
letteral for g.
convert selbri to mex operator; used to create less-used operators using fu'ivla, lujvo, etc.
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought whether-or-not (with gi).
non-restrictive relative phrase marker: which incidentally is associated with ...
location tense relation/direction; approximating/next to ...
pro-bridi: repeats the current bridi.
location tense relation/direction; within/inside of/into ...
unary mathematical operator: factorial; a!.
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if (with gi).
location tense relation/direction; south of.
abstractor: quantity/amount abstractor; $x_{1}$ is quantity/amount of [bridi] measured on scale $x_{2}$.
location tense relation/direction; downwards/down from ...
convert selbri to mex operand; used to create new non-numerical quantifiers; e.g. "herd" of oxen.
nibli modal, 1st place                            logically; logically because ...
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought question (with gi).
discursive: paragraph break; introduce new topic.
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought and (with gi).
digit/number: minus sign; negative number); default any negative.
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought or (with gi).
logical connective: forethought all but tanru-internal whether-or-not (with gi).
digit/number: 0 (digit) [zero].
pro-bridi: repeats the bridi in which this one is embedded.
midpoint scalar negator: neutral point between je'a and to'e; "not really".
non-restrictive relative clause; attaches subordinate bridi with incidental information.
discursive: paragraph break; resume previous topic.
pro-bridi: repeats a remote past bridi.
digit/number: typical/average value.
pro-bridi: repeats a future bridi, normally the next one.
pro-bridi: preceding bridi; in answer to a yes/no question, repeats the claim, meaning yes.
sumti assignment; used to define/assign ko'a/fo'a series pro-sumti; Latin 'sive'.
